ExplntnTxt: EARTH University Foundation was formed to support the educational mission of the Escuela de Agricultura de La Region Tropical Humeda through generous gifts from the global community and other programs and initiatives. The Foundation is a registered 501(c)(3) public charity headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. EARTH University is an international institution created out of a deep conviction that the environmental and social challenges confronting the planet can be resolved through education that promotes science, technology and entrepreneurship while focusing on essential human values, leadership and a commitment to social and environmental service. The University provides support to the Earth University Foundation to cover administrative expenses. The Foundation intends that most of the money it raises be directed to the University to support its educational mission. The University requires periodic reports from the Foundation on the expenses it incurs and the manner in which it is using monies provided by the University. Since the Foundation's primary exempt purpose is to support the University's mission, there is no concern that monies sent to the Foundation will be used other than for a purpose that furthers the University's mission.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS TO HELP DEFRAY THE COST OF ATTENDANCE. SUCH ASSISTANCE IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS AND DONOR STIPULATIONS.
THE COLLEGE PROVIDES TUITION DISCOUNT ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS AFFILIATED WITH CERTAIN ORGANIZATIONS AND PROGRAMS. SUCH ASSISTANCE IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT.

GRANT PROCESS: AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION, STUDENTS REQUEST FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND MUST PROVIDE FINANCIAL INFORMATION (TAX RETURNS, IC/WELFARE VERIFICATION, UNEMPLOYMENT VERIFICATION, A STUDENT AID REPORT OR COLLEGE FINANCIAL AID AWARD LETTER) TO DEMONSTRATE THEIR LEVEL OF NEED. COLLEGE HORIZONS USES THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO DETERMINE FEDERAL GRANT PELL ELIGIBILITY AND CH NEED BASED AID.

The University provides scholarships to individuals to attend the University. Scholarship receipients are selected based on a written application which is reviewed by the University's faculty and staff. Scholarships are awarded based on a combination of student financial need, academic merit, and other factors. The University monitors each recipient student to ensure that he/she remains an active, enrolled student and satisfies the academic and other criteria for maintaining the scholarship.
GRANTS ARE ISSUED TO COVER THE EDUCATION COST OF THE WCMS PROGRAMS.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND MERIT. FUNDS ARE APPLIED TO INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS, AND RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S DOCUMENT RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICY.
SCHOLARSHIPS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF THE COLLEGE OR TRUST INSTRUMENT WHO ESTABLISHED THE SCHOLARSHIP FUND.

SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO ENROLLED STUDENTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS TO COVER TUITION AND FEES. ALSO, FINANCIAL AID RUNS ENROLLMENT REPORTS EACH TERM TO CHECK THE NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS FOR EACH STUDENT.

ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and grants are awarded as financial assistance to students attending Stevens Institute of Technology. Distribution and application of financial assistance are based on the specific criteria of each scholarship and grant and are administered consistent with federal, state, and institutional student aid policies. Situations such as changes in financial need, changes in federal aid eligibility, changes in enrollment and receipt of aid from outside sources may affect a students eligibility to receive funding. Stevens' administration monitors these situations on an on-going basis and makes any appropriate adjustments.

DECISIONS REGARDING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE GOAL IS TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL AID TO APPLICANTS WHO, WITHOUT SUCH AID, WOULD BE UNABLE TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY.
The college has policies and procedures to determine eligibility for student financial assistance. They also comply with the Federal requirements for awarding student aid.

Disbursements in furtherance of the institution's exempt programs are made in accordance with procedures or subject to conditions established by the Institution's governing board designed to ensure that individuals and organizations receiving disbursements from the institution in furtherance of its exempt purpose are adequately investigated to insure that they are qualifying recipients. Students receiving scholarships and fellowships are judged worthy by the institution on the basis of criteria such as academic achievement (fellowships) and financial need (scholarships and fellowships).

No cash is distributed directly to the students.

THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID ONLY TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS ENROLLED AT THE UNIVERSITY. THE FACULTY AND THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT WORK TOGETHER TO AWARD FELLOWSHIPS OR SCHOLARSHIPS TO NEW STUDENTS.

PRE-AWARD SUBRECIPIENT MONITOR: Federal awards are identified by informing each subrecipient of CFDA title and number, award name and number, award year, and name of Federal agency. If any of this information is not available, the pass-through entity shall provide the best information available to describe the Federal award. The subrecipient is advised of requirements imposed by governing laws, regulations, and provisions of contracts or grant agreements and supplemental requirements imposed by the pass-through entity. The subrecipient's activities are monitored to ensure awards are used for authorized purposes in compliance with laws, regulations, and the provisions of contracts or grant agreements and performance goals are achieved. Assurance is ascertained that any subrecipient expending $750,000 or more in Federal awards during the subrecipient's fiscal year must meet the audit requirements of Uniform Grant Guidance (formerly OMB A-133). A management decision on audit findings must be issued within six months after receipt of the subrecipient's audit report and ensure that the subrecipient takes appropriate and timely corrective action. A determination is made as to whether subrecipient audits necessitate adjustment of the pass-through entity's own records. Each subrecipient is required to permit the pass-through entity and auditors to have access to the records and financial statements as necessary for the pass-through entity to comply with this part. POST-AWARD SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING: The Principal Investigator (PI) or Program Director (PD) is responsible for monitoring the activities. The subrecipient should submit progress reports, technical reports and other deliverables to the PI/PD by specified due dates. The PI/PD is responsible for forwarding copies of the subrecipient's report(s) to the Office of Sponsored Programs and Research (OSPR). Subrecipient invoices submitted to the university must contain the following information: invoice on subcontractor's letterhead, date of invoice, invoice number, period of performance covered by the invoice, itemized description of services and backup documentation, current period costs including cost sharing, cumulative project costs and subrecipient contact person with respect to invoice. Invoice must be signed by an authorized official of the subcontractor and must contain a certification that all payments requested are for appropriate purposes and in accordance with the agreements set forth in the application and award documents. The PI/PD is responsible for reviewing and approving invoices from subrecipient(s) for adherence to the budget and submitting invoices for payment in Smart Buy Plus. Grant Accounting will review the subrecipient's invoice(s) for the following: period of performance is within the contract period, appropriate invoice format and level of detail, signature by authorized subrecipient representatives, evidence of cost sharing, if applicable, and availability of funding. Grant Accounting is responsible for ensuring that subrecipients that expend $750,000 or more of Federal funds each fiscal year submit an Audit Certification Letter along with a copy of subrecipient's audited financial statements. The following is required to close out a subrecipient award: receipt of final invoice, receipt of cost share documentation, if applicable, time and effort certifications, final progress and technical reports, annual audit certification letter. Grant Accounting is responsible for tracking payments made to individuals or organizations and where payments are sent when outside of the US as required by the Schedules F and I - Form 990. EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE: Educational assistance is awarded based on financial need and merit. Need based assistance is awarded after review of the student's FAFSA, tax return information, W-2 statements, and other relevant financial documents. Students are required to maintain satisfactory academic progress in order to continue to be eligible for need based assistance. Students' Grade Point Averages and earned units are reviewed each academic year to ensure satisfactory academic progress is achieved. Merit based educational assistance is awarded to students via Committee. Students who are awarded merit based assistance are required to maintain satisfactory academic progress in accordance with the terms of the assistance received. Need and merit based educational assistance are funded directly to the student's accounts receivable balance to offset tuition, fees, and room and board. Any resulting refunds are issued to the student. Students are granted research awards by their academic departments and work with faculty advisors who monitor the research performed by the student.

ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 ALL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE WHICH IS TO PROVIDE AID TO STUDENTS WITH FINANCIAL NEED TO COVER THE STUDENTS' COST OF ATTENDANCE. THESE GRANTS INCLUDE FEDERAL PELL GRANTS, FEDERAL SEOG GRANTS, AND STATE PHEAA GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS DONOR RESTRICTED GRANTS THAT ARE PROVIDED FROM FOUNDATIONS, ALUMNI SCHOLARSHIP DONATIONS, AND OTHER DONORS. THESE ACCOUNTS ARE RECONCILED BY THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ON A MONTHLY BASIS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES AS WELL AS ANY DONOR RESTRICTED GRANT GUIDELINES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REPORTS STUDENT GRANT AWARDS TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND PHEAA THROUGHOUT THE YEAR AND ALSO SUBMITS THE REQUIRED ANNUAL FISAP REPORT TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. AN ANNUAL A-133 AUDIT (FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORT OF INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133) IS CONDUCTED BY THE COLLEGES' EXTERNAL INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS, GENERALLY IN A "PACKAGE" THAT INCLUDES LOANS, COMPENSATION UNDER WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS, AND/OR GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS. THE LOANS ARE PROVIDED PRIMARILY THROUGH PROGRAMS OF THE UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT (INCLUDING DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOAN PROGRAMS) UNDER WHICH THE UNIVERSITY IS RESPONSIBLE ONLY FOR CERTAIN ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES. THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS INCLUDE AWARDS PROVIDED THROUGH GIFTS AND GRANTS FROM PRIVATE DONORS OR FROM INCOME EARNED ON ENDOWMENT FUNDS RESTRICTED FOR STUDENT AID, AS WELL AS GENERAL FUNDS SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS. ROUGHLY 93 PERCENT OF STEVENSON UNIVERSITY STUDENTS RECEIVE SOME SORT OF FINANCIAL AID. ALL INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS FROM STEVENSON UNIVERSITY QUALIFY TO RECEIVE SUCH PAYMENTS BASED ON SCHOLASTIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES NEED-BASED GRANTS, WHICH ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE STUDENTS'S FAFSA SCORE. THE STUDENT MUST MAINTAIN A GPA OF 2.0 OR GREATER AND BE A FULL-TIME STUDENT. DISBURSEMENTS TAKE THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANTS. GRANTS ARE DISBURSED BASED ON THE GUIDELINES SET FORTH BY THE PARTY FUNDING THE GRANT.
ONCE TROCAIRE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS, DISCOUNTS, AND/OR STUDENT AID, AND THE STUDENT ACCEPTS THOSE FUNDS, THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY CREDITS THE STUDENTS TUITION BILL.

Because the awards are made to institutions that are members of the Association, the Association is able to verify that the institution is recognized as a charitable educational institution by appropriate governmental authorities.

CARROLL COLLEGE AND FEDERAL NEED-BASED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE FEDERAL FAFSA AND NEEDS ANALYSIS. FEDERAL FISAP REPORTING IS COMPLETED PRIOR TO OCTOBER OF EACH YEAR FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR.

FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND STUDENT ACCOUNTING AND IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.
Use of grant funds is monitored through student financial aid and billing process.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED UPON THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED WITH EACH GRANT. THE ORGANIZATION HAS A FORMAL POLICY FOR THE PROCESSING AND DISTRIBUTION OF SCHOLARHIP FUNDS. THE ORGANIZATION PROPERLY RECORDS AND TRACKS THE FUND DISTRIBUTED ON A DETAILED BASIS AND THIS DETAIL IS REVIEWED REGULARLY.

Stipends and research fellowships are funds paid to offset living expenses for trainees while they further their education at Rockefeller. These amounts are not considered salary or wages given in consideration for specific job duties nor are they grants given in anticipation of specific scientific achievements on the individuals parts. There is no restriction on the use of the funds once they are received by the trainees.
STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION, WHICH IS APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST A STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT IT IS USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

KFF OPERATES SOLELY FOR THE BENEFIT OF KCC. ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES ARE MADE BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS/REQUESTS FROM THE COLLEGE. EACH GRANT WILL ACCOMPLISH THE EDUCATIONAL GOALS AND PURPOSES OF THE COLLEGE. THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS BY MAINTAINING CONTINUAL CONTACT WITH RECEIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS.
THE COLLEGE MONITORS ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS BY ASSESSING STUDENT RECORDS, FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS APPLICATIONS FOR AWARDS.

THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS RECORDS TO ENSURE FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA IN INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS, AS WELL AS FEDERAL REGULATIONS, OR DONOR RESTRICTIONS. FEDERAL GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON FAFSA INFORMATION.

The Organization only awards financial assistance or grant-in-aid to individuals who are designated to meet the educational expenses of students attending Fuller Theological Seminary. The Organization has established institutional policies for awarding and monitoring of financial assistance. Each award is done in accordance with the policies and compliance is monitored by senior management, to ensure that the amount and eligibility of individuals is in accordance with established policies.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA ON AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT BASIS.

ExplntnTxt: GRANTS ARE PUT INTO A SEPARATE AND UNIQUE FUND AND THE EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AGAINST THE PROPOSAL AND AWARD. THE COLLEGE MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE TWO MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE AMOUNTS GIVEN BY THE GRANT.

THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID'S OFFICE MAINTAINS ALL DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THAT THE AWARDED STUDENTS HAVE SATISFIED THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE VARIOUS GRANTS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY FOR STUDENTS. CRITERIA FOR AWARDING ANY GRANTS IS ALSO MAINTAINED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID'S OFFICE AND IS APPROVED BY THE VP OF ENROLLMENT.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE APPROPRIATENESS OF THE AWARDS AND THESE AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS REQUIRE QUARTERLY PROGRAM REPORTING INCLUDING A NARRATIVE AND FINANCIAL SUMMARY THAT IS REVIEWED BY THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY THE COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE COLLEGE'S POLICY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS GRANTS AND LOANS BASED ON A SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM AND THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL PROGRAMS. THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) MUST BE FILLED OUT AND ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED BASED ON THE INFORMATION PROVIDED. THE GRANT AWARDED IS CREDITED TO THEIR TUITION ACCOUNT AT LYNN UNIVERSITY.

THE COLLEGE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEP. OF EDUCATION POLICY REGARDING TITLE IV FUNDS AND OTHER GRANT AWARDS. THE COLLEGE HAS DEDICATED FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS AND GRANT ADMINISTRATORS. THESE INDIVIDUALS WORK IN CONJUNCTION WITH FINANCE PROFESSIONALS TO ENSURE PROPER STEWARDSHIP OF FUNDS. THESE INDIVIDUALS FOLLOW THE STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE GRANT. FUNDS ARE DRAWN AFTER EXPENSES ARE INCURRED. PROGRESS REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED.

AS FEDERALLY MANDATED, THE SCHOOL PREPARES ANNUALLY A STUDENT COST OF ATTENDANCE BUDGET, WHICH INCLUDES TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND AN ESTIMATE FOR THE COST OF BOOKS, SUPPLIES, TRANSPORTATION, AND PERSONAL EXPENSES. THE SCHOOL THEN AWARDS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED UPON THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AND THE FAMILY'S EXPECTED CONTRIBUTION, AS DETERMINED BY THE FEDERAL NEEDS ANALYSIS FORMULA. STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE FUNDING IN EXCESS OF THE COST OF ATTENDANCE, AND IN CASES WHERE OUTSIDE GRANTS ARE RECEIVED, STUDENT SELF-HELP AID (I.E. LOANS AND WORK-STUDY) IS REDUCED FIRST TO ENSURE THAT AID IS NOT OVER-AWARDED. STUDENTS MUST DOCUMENT ADDITIONAL EDUCATIONALLY-RELATED EXPENSES IN ORDER TO RECEIVE FUNDING ABOVE THEIR UNMET NEEDS.

IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS RESEARCH ACTIVITIES, PRINCETON UNIVERSITY MAKES SUB-AWARDS TO OTHER INSTITUTIONS THAT PERFORM RESEARCH IN CONNECTION WITH RESEARCH GRANTS AWARDED TO PRINCETON UNIVERSITY. PRINCETON UNIVERSITY DOES NOT CATEGORIZE THESE SUB-AWARDS AS "GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE" FOR FORM 990 REPORTING, SINCE THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS PERFORM RESEARCH SERVICES FOR THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE CONSIDERED INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS WHICH SERVE THE DIRECT NEEDS OF THE UNIVERSITY. DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2019, PRINCETON UNIVERSITY MADE SUB-AWARD PAYMENTS TO 198 RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS TOTALING $30,803,313.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS AGREEMENTS WITH VARIOUS GOVERNMENT AGENCIES REGARDING ANNUAL CONTRIBUTIONS. ALSO, EACH YEAR THE UNIVERSITY MAKES NUMEROUS SMALL CONTRIBUTIONS TO COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. THE UNIVERSITY'S DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY AND REGIONAL AFFAIRS REVIEWS REQUESTS FROM LOCAL NON-PROFITS, AND LOOKS TO PROVIDE PROGRAM SUPPORT FOR ORGANIZATIONS IN THE PRINCETON AREA WHO PROVIDE IMPORTANT SERVICES AND RESOURCES TO THE COMMUNITY. ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE EVALUATED TO ASSURE THAT THEY SUPPORT THE PRINCETON COMMUNITY AT LARGE. THE UNIVERSITY'S PACE CENTER FOR CIVIC ENGAGEMENT PROVIDES GRANTS AND SUPPORT EFFORTS BY STUDENTS, FACULTY, STAFF, AND ALUMNI TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS ISSUES OF PUBLIC CONCERN, TO BE ACTIVELY ENGAGED CITIZENS, AND TO PRACTICE EFFECTIVE PUBLIC LEADERSHIP FOR THE PURPOSE OF BUILDING STRONGER COMMUNITIES AND SOCIETIES THROUGHOUT THE WORLD. THE UNDERGRADUATE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MAINTAINS THE RECORDS RELATED TO THE UNDERGRADUATE NEED-BASED GRANTS. THE PROCEDURE IS AS FOLLOWS: THE STUDENTS APPLY ANNUALLY FOR GRANTS BASED ON THEIR FAMILIES' FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. EACH APPLICATION IS THEN REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF GRANT THAT IS NEEDED. THE GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FROM APPROPRIATE SOURCES AND APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S PRINCETON BILL FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD AND OTHER CHARGES. AT THE TIME OF ADMISSION, GRADUATE STUDENT FELLOWSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF A COMBINATION OF ACADEMIC MERIT AND FINANCIAL NEED. ALL STUDENTS MUST REMAIN IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING IN ORDER TO RECEIVE FUNDING. STUDENTS IN CERTAIN PROGRAMS RECEIVE RESEARCH GRANTS AFTER THEIR FIRST YEAR OF STUDY, WHILE OTHER STUDENTS RECEIVE FELLOWSHIPS FOR THE DURATION OF THEIR PROGRAM. GRADUATE STUDENT FELLOWSHIPS ARE FUNDED THROUGH A COMBINATION OF UNIVERSITY RESOURCES INCLUDING ENDOWMENT, GENERAL UNIVERSITY FUNDS, AND/OR DEPARTMENTAL RESOURCES.
The Office of Financial Aid determines eligibility for institutional financial aid based on financial need and/or academic performance.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE COLLEGE AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED PERSONS HAVING AN INTEREST IN THE COLLEGE, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELEY DETERMINED BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER STANDARDS. APPROXIMATELY 1,356 STUDENTS RECEIVED 33,421,415 IN INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND 486,335 IN OTHER FINANCIAL AID.

VIU HAS A FINANCIAL AID OFFICER WHO MONITORS CORRESPONDENCES WITH THE GOVERNMENT AND LIAISES WITH STUDENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICER IS IN CHARGE OF MONITORING THEIR PERFORMANCE THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER BY MONITORING THEM THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICER RECEIVES FEEDBACK FROM BILLING AS WELL AS ADMISSIONS AND OTHER FUNCTIONAL AREAS OF THE ORGANIZATION. FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ADMINISTRATION, STUDENTS ACCOUNTS OFFICE WORKS WITH THE REGISTRAR AND ENSURES THAT EACH STUDENT MEETS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA BEFORE ANY OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED ON SEMESTER BASIS, LOOKING BACK TO PRIOR SEMESTERS. IF THE STUDENT RECEIVED MERIT OR ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS DEPENDENT ON MAINTAINING CERTAIN LEVEL OF GPA, STUDENT ACCOUNTS OFFICE AND REGISTRAR ENSURES THE LEVEL IS MAINTAINED PRIOR TO APPLYING THE SCHOLARSHIP TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT.

THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS PACKAGING GUIDELINES IN AWARDING FUNDS. AID IS PAID ACCORDING TO THE STUDENT ACADEMIC LOAD (100% FOR FULL-TIME, 75% FOR 3/4 TIME). AID IS ADJUSTED ACCORDING TO POLICY. IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS, STUDENT'S ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS ALSO MONITORED TO DETERMINE IF AID SHOULD BE ADJUSTED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grants and scholarships are awarded to students via a direct reduction in their billed tuition for the term under which the grant or scholarship applies. The use of these grants and scholarships is limited in that monies can only be applied to tuition costs related to the specific RFUMS program a recipient is enrolled in.

GSSIMR PROVIDED FELLOWSHIP STIPENDS AND NON-CASH ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF HOUSING AND TRAVEL TO SUMMER SCHOLARS DURING THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE STOWERS SUMMER SCHOLARS PROGRAM. SEE PROGRAM DESCRIPTION ON SCHEDULE O RESPONSE TO FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4B.

Students qualify for federal, state and institutional scholarships, grants and loans based on their individual FAFSA application. Merit awards are based on levels of achievement academically, musically, or artistically. Entitlement grants are given for students with a family connection to the College, denominational affiliation and travel grants for students traveling a long distance from campus. International students may be awarded grants and scholarships to come to study. Grants are awarded by the financial aid office following federal, state and institutional guidelines, which are also monitored and applied in the business office. Funds are audited annually by independent auditors.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS DESIGNED AND IMPLEMENTED INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE WITH GRANTS AND CONTRACTS REQUIREMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION IS ALSO SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL OMB UNIFORM GRANT GUIDANCE AUDIT, AS WELL AS SEFA, WHICH TESTS THE ORGANIZATION'S INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE FOR FEDERAL GRANT COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS. ALL GRANTS RECEIVED BY AUGUSTA UNIVERSITY RESEARCH INSTITUTE, INC. ARE SUBCONTRACTED TO AUGUSTA UNIVERSITY.

OUR FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON SUBMITTED FAFSA DATA AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING COMPLIANCE WITH ALL RELEVANT STATE AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS RELATIVE TO GRANT-BASED AID. THIS SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS REDUCES THE NET AMOUNT PAYABLE TO THE COLLEGE.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Grants inside the US consist of student assistance paid to US students. The office of the registrar administers and monitors all awards. See www.queensu.ca/studentawards/financialassistance for more details.

The College monitors activity of students to whom it provides tuition assistance. Those with no course activity for eight months after the award are notified and a process is initiated can lead to removal of the tuition assistance.

SUPPORT IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY BY DISBURSING DONATED FUNDS TO VARIOUS EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY. THESE DISBURSEMENTS REQUIRE DOCUMENTATION STATING THE REASON FOR THE DISBURSEMENT AND ARE APPROVED BY A SUPERVISOR KNOWLEDGABLE ABOUT THE ACTIVITY REQUESTING THE FUNDING.
THE FOUNDATION REQUIRES THAT THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAIN AND TRACK THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY PROJECT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 ALL FEDERAL TITLE IV FUNDS RECEIVED BY BRYANT UNIVERSITY ARE MANAGED IN STRICT COMPLIANCE WITH ALL REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE PROGRAM PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT, A FORMAL AGREEMENT BETWEEN BRYANT UNIVERSITY AND THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. THE PROGRAM PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT IS PERSONALLY ENDORSED BY BOTH THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OF BRYANT UNIVERSITY AND THE SECRETARY OF THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. COMPLIANCE WITH ALL TITLE IV REQUIREMENTS IS MONITORED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF FOUR (EXEMPT) PROFESSIONAL FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTRATORS AND THREE (NON-EXEMPT) SUPPORT STAFF MEMBERS. COMPLIANCE CAPABILITY IS GREATLY ENHANCED THROUGH THE USE OF THE BANNER INTEGRATED MANAGEMENT INFORMATION SYSTEM AND ITS EFFECTIVE INTERFACE WITH OTHER DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION SYSTEMS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE FOR COMMUNITY SUPPORT TO VARIOUS ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH THEIR FUNDRAISING EVENTS. IN THE CURRENT YEAR, NO ORGANIZATION RECEIVED OVER $5,000 FROM THE UNIVERSITY IN THIS CAPACITY.
Detail List available if requested.
The Puritan Reformed Theological Seminary Foundation exists to support the Seminary. The Foundation manages the long term investments to provide operational and scholarship funds for the Seminary.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE HEADED BY THE ACADEMIC DIRECTOR AND WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF REGIONAL ACADEMIC DIRECTORS. ONCE AWARDED, THE REGISTRAR MAINTAINS ALL OFFICIAL RECORDS, NOTIFIES RECIPIENTS AND CORRESPONDS WITH STUDENTS REGARDING THEIR ACCOUNTS. THE FINANCE OFFICE, HEADED BY THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER, IS RESPONSIBLE FOR UPDATING STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND REPORTING TO THE DONORS. THE CHIEF EXCUTIVE OFFICE REVIEWS FINAL ALLOCATION OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS.
THE COLLEGE RECONCILES GRANTS AWARDED AND DRAWDOWNS OF FUNDS. GRANT PROGRAMS ARE AUDITED BY INDEPENDENT AUDITORS DURING THE ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDIT.

MERIT AND ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS AND CURRENT ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. OTHER INTERNAL AND ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SPECIFIC TO THE SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID AND THE FINANCE OFFICE OF THE COLLEGE.

Master's University and Seminary awards financial aid grants to students in accordance with the University's institutional financial aid policies. All scholarships are awarded to current students of the institution, thus enabling the institution to track their academic performance and use of all scholarship funds. Scholarships funds are directly applied to the student accounts, with no cash changing hands.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP/DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT MAINTAINED WITH OLLU. THE ORGANIZATION REVIEWS ALL PROPOSALS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT GUIDELINES AND APPROVES PRIOR TO THE EXPENSE BEING INCURRED. THE PROJECT DIRECTOR TRACKS SPENDING ON GRANTS MONTHLY TO ENSURE NO BUDGET OVERAGES. WHEN RECORDING THE BILLINGS MONTHLY, THE GRANT ACCOUNTANT ALSO MONITORS THE SPENDING TO MAKE SURE EXPENSES ARE REASONABLE AND WITHIN THE BUDGET OF THE GRANT.
ORGANIZATION RECEIVES OFFICIAL RECEIPTS FOR THE GRANTS GIVEN
The University follows the requirements of the research agreements.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: FOR FOUNDATION SCHOLARSHIPS, THE FOUNDATION GENERALLY RECEIVES THE FUNDS DIRECTLY OR VIA THE DISTRICT CASHIER'S OFFICE AND DEPOSITS THEM INTO A "CONTRIBUTIONS" ACCOUNT TO TRACK THE REVENUE. THE MANAGER RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS MONITOR, REVIEW AND VERIFY THAT EXPENSES CHARGED TO THE SCHOLARSHIPS QUALIFY UNDER THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE DONOR. SCHOLARSHIP EXPENSES ARE CHARGED DIRECTLY TO OBJECT CODES WITHIN THE FOUNDATION FUNDS CALLED STUDENT AWARDS AND GRANTS OR GRANTS PAID.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY FOR STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE UNIVERSITY AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND ATHLETIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

Scholarships and awards are awarded according to scholarship protocols and are continually monitored for satisfactory progress. These scholarships are applied directly to each student's account at the College.

RESEARCH GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE CONTRIBUTORS WHO CONTRIBUTE MONEY BASED ON REACHING PREDEFINED MILESTONES AND REQUIRE PERIODIC REPORTING. TUITION ASSISTANCE IS NOT MONITORED BECAUSE PAYMENTS ARE MADE DIRECTLY TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI. AWARDS PAID TO INDIVIDUALS ARE NOT MONITORED BECAUSE THEY ARE AWARDED BASED ON MEETING THE SELECTION CRITERIA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarship funds can be used for tuition, books and living expenses. In general they are applied first to tuition and balances sent to students. It is reviewed every school term and is monitored in compliance with student aid protocols. All payments are monitored and approved by Student Services and Finance before payment is applied or paid to the student. All students receiving scholarships have been selected on a non-discretionary basis. The student loan program is audited every year in compliance with federal single audit standards

Scholarships issued to University students are applied to the student's account. A list of scholarship, fellowship and grant assistance awarded is on file at the University. Although there may be recipients who are related to persons having interest in the University, such persons are selected on an equal and objective basis as with other recipients. All students receiving assistance are selected on the University's criteria for academic and financial need, and other similar criteria. The University does not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, ethnic or racial origin, physical or mental disability, marital or veteran status in administration of scholarships or loans. Also, note that the University provides remitted tuition to qualified faculty, staff and certain dependents as a benefit of employment. The University monitors the student accounts and eligibility.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WHEN STUDENTS ARE AWARDED A TUITION SCHOLARSHIP, THE COUNCIL SENDS THE MONEY DIRECTLY TO THE SCHOOL THE STUDENT IS ATTENDING WITH INSTRUCTIONS THAT IT IS TO BE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION. IF THE STUDENT DROPS THE CLASS OR OTHERWISE DOES NOT ATTEND, THE REFUND IS RETURNED TO THE COUNCIL. THIS PROCESS ENSURES THE SCHOLARSHIP IS USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE.

THE COLLEGE DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS ANY EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS OVER THEIR CHARGES, THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE COLLEGE HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE COLLEGE'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE COLLEGE'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Ongoing correspondence with grantee.

THE GRANTS ARE EXECUTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH EACH RESPECTIVE GRANT AGREEMENT. THEY ARE RECONCILED MONTHLY AS PART OF OUR MONTH END CLOSE PROCEDURE. EACH GRANT IS REPORTED TO ITS RESPECTIVE AGENCY AS REQUIRED IN THE GRANT AGREEMENT (I.E. MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ONE TIME).

THE UNIVERSITY ATTEMPTS TO MAKE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WITHIN THE LIMITS OF EACH STUDENT BUDGET AND THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, PROFESSIONAL PROMISE, LEADERSHIP POTENTIAL, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR SPECIFIC GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY DONORS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED ON THE BASIS OF INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ADDITIONALLY, THE UNIVERSITY MAKES AVAILABLE FEDERAL WORK STUDY FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN WHICH ELIGIBLE AWARD AMOUNTS ARE ALSO BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED INFORMATION PROVIDED WITHIN THE FAFSA. WORK STUDY EXPENDED AND AVAILABLE FUNDS ARE TRACKED AND REVIEWED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.

THE COLLEGE DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS ANY EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS OVER THEIR CHARGES, THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE COLLEGE HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTING MANAGER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER. THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE COLLEGE'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

A FILE IS CREATED FOR EACH GRANTEE, WHICH CONTAINS THE OFFICIAL INSTITUTIONAL STUDENT INFORMATION RECORD FROM THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR FROM WHICH ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED ACCORDING TO FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES FOR THE AWARDING OF FINACIAL ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: GRANTS ARE PUT INTO A SEPARATE AND UNIQUE FUND AND THE EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AGAINST THE PROPOSAL AND AWARD. WESTERN UNIVERSITY MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE TWO MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE STUDENT FIRST APPLIES FOR ASSISTANCE, AND THEN BASED ON THE GRANT CRITERIA (FINANCIAL AND ENROLLMENT), THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE AMOUNTS GIVEN BY THE GRANT. GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP AWARD COMMITTEES AWARD THE RECIPIENTS.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE COLLEGE AND ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED AGAINST THEIR TUITION COSTS.
HALLMARK MAKES GRANTS TO WORTHY ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE THE SAME BELIEFS AS THE UNIVERSITY.

THE COLLEGE ENSURES THAT ITS GRANTS OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED EDUCATIONAL PURPOSE BY APPLYING THE AWARDS DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' TUITION BALANCES INSTEAD OF ISSUING CHECKS. THE COLLEGE ALSO MAKES ENTREPRENEURIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL GRANTS THROUGH ITS LAUNCH U PROGRAM AND GREEN EDGE FUND. POTENTIAL GRANTEES SUBMIT APPLICATIONS FOR THE GRANTS, AND AFTER A RIGOROUS REVIEW PROCESS, GRANTS ARE AWARDED. GRANTEES ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT REPORTS WHICH INDICATE HOW THE GRANT FUNDS WERE SPENT.

The Academy provides scholarships to individuals to attend the Academy. Scholarship receipients are selected based on a written application which is reviewed by the Academy's faculty and staff. Scholarships are awarded based on a combination of student financial need, academic merit, and other factors and are applied directly to the student's account as a reduction in tuition and fees. The Academy monitors each recipient student to ensure that he/she remains an active, enrolled student and satisfies the academic and other criteria for maintaining the scholarship.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS ARE PRIMARILY TO STUDENTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT RECEIVABLE BALANCE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS PRIMARILY RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF THE AID. THIS IS DONE THROUGH SOFTWARE DESIGNED TO ASSIST IN THE PROCESS.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TOWARDS THE PAYMENT OF TUITION AND FEES IN WHICH CASE THE GRANT AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED FOR VARIOUS REASONS TO STUDENTS, FACULTY AND STAFF FOR EDUCATIONAL OR WORK RELATED ACTIVITIES. IN THESE CASES EXPENSE VERIFICATION IS REQUIRED IN THE FORM OF RECEIPTS AND OTHER APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION.

THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH IS REQUIRED TO REVIEW EACH REQUEST FOR PAYMENT PRIOR TO AUTHORIZATION OF PAYMENT TO A VENDOR OR PURCHASE. FOR FINANCIAL AID RELATED GRANTS THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID RECEIVES NOTICES OF AWARD AND AWARDS TO THE STUDENT BASED ON THE STIPULATIONS WITHIN THE GRANT. GRANT FUNDS ARE EACH ASSIGNED THEIR OWN FUND CODE TO ENSURE THAT GRANTS FUNDS ARE TRACKED PROPERLY, P.I.'S AND THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH HAVE ACCESS TO REVIEW EXPENDITURES TO ENSURE THAT ONLY APPROPRIATE COSTS HAVE BEEN CHARGED TO THE GRANT. THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH ALSO HAS WRITTEN PRE AND POST AWARD POLICIES AND GUIDELINES RELATED TO THE GRANTS FUNDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID SERVICES AWARDS FINANCIAL AID IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE HIGHER EDUCATION ACT. FEDERAL AND STATE AWARDING GUIDELINES ARE USED IN AWARDING STUDENT'S FINANCIAL AID. STUDENT ACCOUNTS ARE REVIEWED ON A BI-WEEKLY BASIS TO ENSURE THAT ALL STUDENTS ARE CURRENTLY ENROLLED ACCORDING TO APPROPRIATE GUIDELINES. A QUALITY CONTROL CHECK IS IN PLACE IN THAT A FILE AUDIT IS PERFORMED OF A RANDOM SAMPLE OF FILES TO ENSURE THAT PROPER PROCEDURES ARE BEING FOLLOWED. AN ANNUAL AUDIT IS PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE COMPANY TO ENSURE THAT THERE ARE NO GROSS VIOLATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS.

The College maintains records for all Muhlenberg students receiving financial assistance administered by the College. Records include academic performance and information regarding family/household income.
THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE PRACTICE OF DIRECTLY APPLYInG SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT AT THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET TUITION AND FEES.

THE GRANTEE, AUBURN UNIVERSITY, IS A SECTION 115 ENTITY. AS A LAND-GRANT INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION, ITS MAJOR SOURCE OF FUNDS ARE FEDERAL AND STATE APPROPRIATIONS AND THEREFORE, ITS DISBURSEMENTS ARE GOVERNED BY FEDERAL AND ALABAMA STATE LAWS. ITS TRANSACTIONS ARE SUBJECT TO PUBLIC DISCLOSURE. THE AUBURN UNIVERSITY REAL ESTATE FOUNDATION, INC. HAS ACCESS TO THE FINANCIAL RECORDS. GRANTS DESIGNATED FOR A SPECIFIC PURPOSE ARE CREDITED TO A FUND ESTABLISHED FOR THAT PURPOSE. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCUREMENT AND PAYMENT SERVICES OFFICE ENSURES COMPLIANCE WITH THE FUND'S RESTRICTIONS SUBJECT TO ANY APPLICABLE LAWS.
THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE BASED UPON THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

ASSISTANCE IS GIVEN TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE FORM OF CREDITS TOWARD THE COST OF TUITION, AND A RECORD OF THE ASSISTANCE PROVIDED IS RECORDED IN SEPARATE ACCOUNTS MAINTAINED FOR EACH STUDENT/RECIPIENT. IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE INSTITUTION'S BUDGET PROCESS, EACH SCHOOL DETERMINES SCHOLARSHIP SPENDING FOR THE YEAR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS FINANCIAL AID TO APPLICANTS AT EACH SCHOOL ACCORDING TO THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED FOR EACH AWARD TYPE. THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE COMMUNICATE ABOUT AND RECONCILE DISBURSEMENTS. THE INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT DEPARTMENT PROVIDES ANNUAL REPORTS TO THE DONORS REGARDING THE USE OF DONOR-CONTRIBUTED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS.

THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THROUGH CONTROLS WITHIN THE ACCOUNTING AND INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT OFFICES. THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR RECEIVES, VETS AND COORDINATES SUBMITTALS FOR GRANTS. THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR MONITORS THE AWARDS OF FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT. THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR AND ACCOUNTING OFFICE MONITOR WORK PERFORMED, BILLING, GRANT CLOSE OUT, AND POST GRANT REPORTING. THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS AND THE VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION OVERSEE AND APPROVE GRANTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR THE TYPE OF AWARD. VARIOUS CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED, OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY DONORS OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 2 - PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS FUNDS IN U.S.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS AWARDED ARE BASED ON NEED AND CONFORM TO FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON A THOROUGH REVIEW AND VERIFICATION OF A FAMILY'S INCOME, ASSETS, SIZE AND NUMBER OF DEPENDENTS ENROLLED IN COLLEGE. ANNUAL EXPENDITURE REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS FOR REVIEW. THE FUND EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE IN AN ANNUAL AUDIT CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT FURTHER MONITOR THE USAGE OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THESE AMOUNTS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY AGAINST STUDENTS TUITION ACCOUNT AND THERE IS NO OPPORTUNITY FOR THE STUDENT TO DIVERT THESE FUNDS TO NON-EDUCATIONAL USES.

SCHEDULE I, PART III A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE COLLEGE. THE RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGE COMMITTEES THAT JUDGE THE APPLICANTS. THE COLLEGE HAS PROCEDURES THAT ARE DESIGNED TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS FROM THE COLLEGE QUALIFY TO RECEIVE PAYMENTS. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ENSURES THAT GRANTS AND AWARDS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH PROCEDURES ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGE.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEEDS ASSESSMENTS AND/OR PERFORMANCE. ONCE THE STUDENT HAS BEEN APPROVED TO RECEIVE THE GRANT, THE AMOUNT IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S BAKER COLLEGE ACCOUNT. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE MONITORS THE STUDENT TO MAKE SURE THE AWARD STAYS IN COMPLIANCE. IF THE STUDENT DOES NOT CONTINUE TO MEET THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS, THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT MAY BE REDUCED. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES ARE BUDGETED EACH YEAR BY THE BAKER COLLEGE CAMPUS. THE CAMPUS PRESIDENT(S) DETERMINES WHICH ORGANIZATION BENEFITS FROM A GRANT BASED ON THE COMMUNITY'S NEEDS. IF THE GRANT EXCEEDS THE BUDGET, THE BOARD OF REGENTS MUST APPROVE THE FUNDING. THESE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE AWARDED TO OTHER TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS TO BE USED IN ANY WAY THE RECIPIENTS SEE FIT TO FURTHER THEIR MISSION AND TAX EXEMPT PURPOSE; THE USE OF THESE FUNDS IS NOT MONITORED BY BAKER COLLEGE.

Gustavus offers both merit-based and need-based scholarship assistance. Merit-based scholarships do not require a student to demonstrate financial eligibility and must be awarded during the Admission process. They also may be awarded as part of a need-based financial aid package. To be renewed, the student needs to maintain the established minimum standards. Need-based scholarships are offered to students who demonstrate financial eligibility by filing the FAFSA. The offered amounts can vary from year to year as determined by the family's Estimated Family Contribution (EFC) on the FAFSA and availability of funds. The Registrar's office monitors any changes to a student's enrollment status. Any changes are communicated to the Student Accounts office and the Financial Assistance office to ensure funds are being properly disbursed. Also see Schedule F, Part V with respect to monitoring of students taking J-Term or semester studies outside of the United States.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A VARIETY OF CRITERIA, GENERALLY ACADEMIC MERIT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED BY THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENT'S TUITION BILLING ACCOUNT BALANCE.

GRANTS PAID BY THE COLLEGE INCLUDE SUBAWARDS OF FEDERAL RESEARCH FUNDS AND SUPPORT OF CERTAIN CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE WORCESTER AREA. THESE GRANTS ARE CLOSELY TIED TO PROMOTING THE COLLEGE'S CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL MISSION AND CONTRIBUTE TO THE ENRICHMENT OF THE GREATER WORCESTER AREA.

THE COLLEGE SUPPORTS A NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID POLICY THAT IS REPRESENTATIVE OF ITS ACADEMIC AND SPIRITUAL GOALS AS AN UNDERGRADUATE, JESUIT, LIBERAL ARTS COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE WILL MEET THE FULL DEMONSTRATED NEED OF EACH STUDENT, AS CALCULATED ACCORDING TO NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED FINANCIAL AID CRITERIA. ALL STUDENTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY REGARDLESS OF THEIR SOCIO-ECONOMIC BACKGROUND. OVER 50% OF ALL STUDENTS ADMITTED RECEIVE SOME FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TO RECEIVE AID.
THE GRANTEES WERE APPROVED BY THE UNIVERSITY PRESIDENT AND CONFIRMED WITH THE VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCIAL AFFAIRS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ACCORDING TO THE CRITERIA IDENTIFIED FOR INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. APPLICATIONS ARE RECEIVED FROM STUDENTS AND REVIEWED BY THE RESPECTIVE COMMITTEE, EITHER THE FACULTY OR THE ADMISSIONS COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE AWARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Student aid is based on academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. The College evaluates student eligibility at the end of each semester for the following term and also before disbursement of financial aid.

THE ACADEMIC PROGRESS OF FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS IS MONITORED A MINIMUM OF ONCE EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. STUDENTS SHOULD CONTACT THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH QUESTIONS REGARDING THE INTENT AND/OR INTERPRETATION OF THESE STANDARDS. COMPLETION RATE AND GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) REQUIREMENTS FULL-TIME STUDENTS (STUDENTS ATTEMPTING 12 OR MORE CREDIT HOURS EACH SEMESTER) MUST PROGRESS ACCORDING TO THE FOLLOWING SCHEDULE: MINIMUM CREDITS MINIMUM REQUIRED COMPLETED CUMULATIVE GPA YEAR 1 24 1.70 YEAR 2 48 2.00 YEAR 3 72 2.00 YEAR 4 96 2.00 YEAR 5 123 2.00 THESE CREDIT HOURS MUST BE EARNED DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR (FALL, WINTER AND SPRING). HOWEVER, IF A STUDENT DOES NOT MEET THESE REQUIRED HOURS, THEY MAY BE EARNED DURING THE FOLLOWING SUMMER SESSION(S). FAILURE TO ACHIEVE THIS STANDARD BY THE END OF THE SUMMER WILL RESULT IN THE LOSS OF FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY UNTIL THE COMPLETED CUMULATIVE HOURS MEET THE MINIMUM STANDARDS. LOSS OF AID IS NOT THE SAME AS ACADEMIC SUSPENSION, WHICH IS HANDLED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS. PART-TIME STUDENTS MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE ONE-HALF OF THE CREDIT HOURS THEY ATTEMPT. COMBINED STUDENTS (STUDENTS BLENDING TERMS OF FULL- AND PART-TIME ENROLLMENT) MUST ACHIEVE A CUMULATIVE TOTAL THAT SATISFIES THE COMBINED FULL- AND PART-TIME STANDARDS. STUDENTS WHO DO NOT ACHIEVE THE MINIMUM CUMULATIVE GPA ARE GRANTED ONE PROBATIONARY SEMESTER IN WHICH TO RAISE THEIR CUMULATIVE GPA TO THE MINIMUM. FAILURE TO ACHIEVE THIS STANDARD AT ANY POINT FOLLOWING THE PROBATIONARY SEMESTER RESULTS IN THE LOSS OF FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY UNTIL THE CUMULATIVE GPA MEETS THE MINIMUM STANDARDS.

FINANCIAL AID IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS TO COVER ANY OUTSTANDING INSTITUTIONAL CHARGES. ANY CREDIT BALANCE IS REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT TO BE USED FOR OTHER EDUCATIONAL-RELATED EXPENSES. STUDENTS RECEIVING FEDERAL AND/OR STATE AID MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). BY SIGNING THE FAFSA, THE STUDENT AGREES THAT HE OR SHE "WILL USE FEDERAL AND/OR STATE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID ONLY TO PAY THE COST OF ATTENDING AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION."

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STUDENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN TO INDIVIDUALS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT TO AID WITH TUITION AND FEES. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE A REDUCTION OF TUITION AND FEES AND PROVIDED DIRECTLY BY THE UNIVERSITY. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA.

FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED OF THE RECIPIENT'S FAMILY. FINANCIAL INFORMATION AND SUGGESTED FINANCIAL NEED OF THE RECIPIENT'S PARENT(S) OR GUARDIAN(S) IS PROVIDED TO THE SCHOOL BY AN INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS REPRESENT SCHOLARSHIP/FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO U.S. STUDENTS TO ATTEND THE COLLEGE IN THE UNITED STATES. BENNINGTON MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF TRANSCRIPTS, GRADES, AND WRITTEN NARRATIVES BY BOTH FACULTY AND STUDENTS. PROGRESS TOWARD THE REQUIREMENTS TO COMPLETE A DEGREE IS CLOSELY MONITORED. GRANTS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO CURRENTLY ENROLLED STUDENTS.
SCHOLARSHIPS AMOUNTS ARE PAID BASED ON A COMPREHENSIVE APPLICATION PROCESS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED AGAINST TUITION OWED.
SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS MUST MEET REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED BY A COMMITTEE OF THE COLLEGE.

THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL AID STARTS AFTER A STUDENT IS ACCEPTED INTO BLUFFTON UNIVERSITY. THOSE STUDENTS WHO NEED FINANCIAL SUPPORT HAVE TO FILE AN APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. BLUFFTON UNIVERSITY OFFERS UNIVERSITY FUNDS, STATE AND FEDERAL GRANTS AND STUDENT LOANS. NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE CALCULATIONS FROM FAFSA AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENTS. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DETERMINED AT THE TIME OF ACCEPTANCE AND BASED OFF OF HIGH SCHOOL GPA AND STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES OR TRANSFERRING GPA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDUULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: TO ENSURE PROPER USE OF THE GRANTS AWARDED, USAC CREDITS THE GRANT AMOUNT DIRECTLY TO THE PROGRAM FEE ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT LIMITING ITS DIVERSION TO UNINTENDED USES
Student financial aid is credited to the individual student accounts and their net balances are monitored by the Business Office.

FINANCIAL AID MONITORS ALL THE SCHOLARSHIPS THAT ARE AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS TO MAKE SURE THEY FALL WITHIN THE REQUIRED GUIDELINES. GRANTS TO DOMESTIC ORGANIZATIONS ARE LIMITED AND GENERALLY DE MINIMIS. GRANTS OF MORE THAN $5000 ARE DOCUMENTED WITH THE RECIPIENT DOMESTIC ORGANIZATION AND THEIR PROPER USE CONFIRMED.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID AND/OR ASSISTANCE FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES IS DISTRIBUTED AND MONITORED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERALLY APPROVED NEED ANALYSIS CRITERIA OR OTHER AGENCY PROVIDED CRITERIA. IN ADDITION TO STUDENT FINANCIAL AID, THE COLLEGE ALSO PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS IN SUPPORT OF COMMUNITY GOALS THAT ALIGN WITH THE MISSION OF THE COLLEGE. AS THE COLLEGE IS SELECTIVE IN WHICH ORGANIZATIONS IT SUPPORTS, MONITORING OF THE FUNDS IS NOT A PART OF THE AWARD PROCESS AFTER FUNDING HAS TAKEN PLACE.

ALL GRANTS ARE AWARDED ONLY AFTER CONFIRMING A STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY -CONSISTENT TO ALL GRANT CRITERIA. EACH SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT IS RECONCILED AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER AND AWARD YEAR TO VERIFY STUDENTS MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY. REPORTS MONITORING GPA, CITIZENSHIP, FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL ELIGIBILITY ARE USED TO AWARD AND ENSURE RECONCILIATION FOR EACH FUND.

The college's Office of Student Financial Services is responsible for awarding and monitoring all college, federal and state grant assistance. More than 60% of Wheaton students receive some form of financial aid and all students who demonstrate need receive aid. Financial assistance at Wheaton is awarded on the basis of demonstrated need and academic performance. "Need" is determined by the financial information that a student and his/her family provides on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and CSS PROFILE forms which capture the data required to determine eligibility based on federal and/or state regulations and institutional fund eligibility guidelines. A need-based package may include a merit scholarship, grants, loans or work award. When funds are awarded, student eligibility is monitored through the college's operational system financial aid module to ensure there are no changes in status that might affect their ongoing eligibility. Total grant funds awarded are tracked to ensure compliance with budgeted amounts.

CMU DISTRIBUTES LIMITED FINANCIAL AID AND GRANT FUNDS TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. BASED ON A STATISTICAL MODEL THAT TAKES INTO ACCOUNT A STUDENT'S INTENDED COLLEGE MAJOR, ACADEMIC AND ARTISTIC TALENTS, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL NEED. FOR STUDENTS, SUCH FUNDS ARE TYPICALLY APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION AT CMU. OTHER TYPES OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE MIGHT INCLUDE, FOR EXAMPLE, RECIPIENTS OF PRIZES AND AWARDS WHO HAVE MET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR THE PARTICULAR PRIZE OR AWARD TO BE SELECTED. IN THE CASE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS, THE RECIPIENT IS OFTEN REQUIRED TO UTILIZE THE FUNDS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION AND RESEARCH AT CMU. GRANTS ARE ALSO MADE IN THE CONTEXT OF ACADEMIC OR RESEARCH PROGRAMS AND RECIPIENTS SPEND THEIR GRANT FUNDS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE PROGRAM FOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. SPONSORED PROJECT FUNDS ARE PASSED THROUGH TO SUB-GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS BY CARNEGIE MELLON WHEN SUCH SUB-GRANTEE ARRANGEMENTS ARE APPROVED BY THE PRIMARY GRANT SPONSOR. FUNDS ARE SPENT UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS AND ARE ACCOUNTABLE TO FEDERAL AND SPONSOR TERMS AND CONDITIONS.
Grants are in the form of scholarships awarded to students and are given as a reduction of outstanding tuition.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U. S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVERALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOLLOWS ALL REGULATIONS WHEN AWARDING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY IS REVIEWED EACH TERM TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH AWARDING INSTITUTIONAL, FEDERAL AND STATE AID WITH POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. THE COLLEGE ALSO FILES ANNUAL STATE GRANT YEAR END REPORTING, FISAP AND IPEDS DATA. STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON THEIR PER TERM STANDING AND AID IS EVALUATED BASED ON THEIR ENROLLMENT.

Pitzer College awards scholarships only to individual undergraduate students. These scholarships are awarded based upon academic achievement and/or demonstrated financial need. The Financial Aid Office, with the assistance of the Registrar's Office, monitor student enrollment each semester to ensure that students remain qualified for financial aid. The College also awards tuition to dependents of its employees who meet the requirements of the College's Tuition Remission Program. Employee dependents must be enrolled at one of the undergraduate schools of The Claremont Colleges. Tuition is paid directly to the undergraduate college after grades are submitted to the Human Resources Office as evidence of course completion.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: MARYVILLE UNIVERSITY USES FINANCIAL AID COMPUTER SOFTWARE THAT PROVIDES ALL DETAILS OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS TO RECIPIENTS TO INCLUDE ANNUAL AND CUMULATIVE AMOUNTS AND ELIGIBILITY. ALL GRANTS IN AID ARE POSTED AS A CREDIT TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
COLLEGETRACKS STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE GRANTS THROUGH COLLEGE TRACKS PARTICIPATE IN OUR COLLEGE SUCCESS PROGRAM, THROUGH WHICH WE MONITOR THEIR ACADEMIC AND OTHER PROGRESS THROUGH COLLEGE.

THE UNIVERSITY OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICIES AND DONOR GUIDELINES. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO MAINTAINS COMPREHENSIVE RECORDS OF THE SAME.
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS AND STUDENT TRANSCRIPTS ARE REVIEWED AND KEPT ON FILE TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE MET FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.
ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED GRANTS IS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE "FREE APPLICATION" FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY A STUDENT'S ADMISSION APPLICATION.

BAY PATH UNIVERSITY RECEIVES GRANT MONEY FROM FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. THIS GRANT MONEY IS DISBURSED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AS IT IS RECEIVED BY THE UNIVERISITY. STUDENT AWARDS ARE BASED ON THE FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES FOR EACH TYPE OF GRANT. GRANTS TO CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL POLICIES

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S MONITORING PROCEDURES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING STEPS: 1, PERFORM A RISK ASSESSMENT ON SUB-RECIPIENT 2, PERFORM SITE VISITS TO REVIEW FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC RECORDS 3, ENSURE THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR HAS REGULAR CONTRACTS 4, ENSURE A CURRENT CERTIFICATION OR A-133 AUDIT IS PERFORMED AND THE RELATED REPORT RECEIVED AND REVIEWED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: form 990, schedule i, part i, question 1
ExplntnTxt: description of organization's procedures for monitoring the use of grants all scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria. the financial aid office, based upon the criteria, recommends scholarship awards to the scholarship committee. the scholarship committee reviews the recommendations and approves the recommendations. the financial aid office then awards the scholarships.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: form 990, schedule i, part iii column a
ExplntnTxt: types of assistance provided to individuals in the united states 301 scholarships were awarded to pay tuition and fees for students attending morehouse school of medicine in the m.d. and mph degree programs. total scholarships awarded were $2,960,831.

FIELDING GRADUATE UNIVERSITY AWARDS TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE IMMEDIATELY APPLIED AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION CHARGES. FIELDING GRADUATE UNIVERSITY AWARDS RESEARCH GRANTS TO FACULTY MEMBERS AND STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY AND REQUIRES WRITTEN REPORTS FROM GRANT RECIPIENTS.

Federal and State Grants are award based on Federal Title IV and state higher educational compliance requirements. Institutional Scholarships are awarded based upon parameters established by each endowment fund and are monitored by a university scholarship committee. Scholarships are awarded without respect to race, creed & color.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ALL SWARTHMORE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED/POSTED ELECTRONICALLY (AND INTERNALLY) DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT. FURTHERMORE, STUDENTS RECEIVING SAID FUNDS ARE UNABLE TO WITHDRAWAL IT FROM THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT.

ALL FEDERAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DURING THE AWARD PROCESS. FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AND ARE RECONCILED TO THE AWARD BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE CONTROLLER. THE MONEY IS DISBURSED TO THOSE APPLICABLE STUDENTS BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE BURSAR.

THE COLLEGE MAKES GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE. THE SELECTION OF GRANT RECIPIENTS IS MADE BASED UPON OBJECTIVE CRITERIA. NO ONE IS DISCRIMINATED AGAINST BASED UPON RACE, RELIGION, GENDER, ETHNIC BACKGROUND, AGE, HANDICAP OR ANY OTHER REASON. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ASSESSES AND MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. IT IS ASSISTED IN ITS ON-GOING REVIEW BY THE RESOURCES OF THE REGISTRAR AND STUDENT ACCOUNTS DEPARTMENTS.

The Business office reviews the recipient's Form 990 and Uniform Guidance audit report if available. The Director of the program at VLS works closely with the recipient of the funds that will be paid by the grant to coordinate activities/training essential for program effectiveness. The recipient submits invoices to VLS which are reviewed and approved by the Program Director to substantiate the grant related purpose. The invoice is then forwarded to the business office for review and coding to the proper accounts. The funds are then forwarded to the recipient.

THE COLLEGE ONLY GIVES SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING ITS CLASSES. SCHEDULE I, PART III, (B) - THIS NUMBER REPRESENTS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED. SOME STUDENTS MAY HAVE RECEIVED MULTIPLE SCHOLARSHIPS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICY. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ADHERES STRICTLY TO ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROLS OF OMB-A133 (IN WHICH THEY FOLLOW ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES).

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY OF EACH STUDENT WHO APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID, USING FORMULAS AND CRITERIA PROMULGATED BY VARIOUS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL BODIES, AS WELL AS MARYWOOD'S INTERNALLY ESTABLISHED RULES AND PROCEDURES.

Awarded grants and scholarships are directly credited against the student's tuition balance; no cash changes hands. The Financial Aid Office tracks the amounts awarded and periodically runs reports to check for changes in eligibility for all outside grants or scholarships.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY THE COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE COLLEGE'S POLICY.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY MONITORING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF COURSES AND PROGRAMS TOWARDS EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STUDENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS.

IN THE UNITED STATES SOKA UNIVERSITY OF AMERICA SERVES AS A CONDUIT TO RECEIVE AND DISBURSE STUDENT AID FUNDS FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES SUCH AS THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION UNDER THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS: - FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT - FEDERAL PELL AWARD GRANT PROGRAM - FEDERAL WORK STUDY - GI BILL INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS ARE AWARDED BY SOKA UNIVERSITY OF AMERICA TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WHO MEET SPECIFIC ACADEMIC AND ACHIEVEMENT CRITERIA. THE PURPOSES OF THESE GRANTS ARE CLEARLY COMMUNICATED TO THE RECIPIENTS AND ARE INTERNALLY USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN (B) THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED IN COLUMN (B) IS DETERMINED BY REVIEWING THE EXACT NUMBER OF STUDENTS WHO RECEIVED THE TYPE OF AID INDICATED.

GRANT FUNDS DISBURSED BY THE COLLEGE ARE PREDOMINANTLY AVAILABLE AS MERIT OR NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO PAY FOR TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. THEY ARE THEN MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS OFFICE, BOTH OF WHOM ARE NOTIFIED IF THE STUDENT'S NORMAL ENROLLMENT STATUS CHANGES DURING THE SEMESTER. THESE OFFICES MONITOR WHETHER THE GRANTEE IS TAKING THE NECESSARY CLASSES AND IS THEREFORE UTILIZING THE GRANT AS IT WAS INTENDED. IF A STUDENT'S ENROLLMENT CHANGES, AWARD ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE. OTHER GRANT FUNDS ARE DISBURSED BY THE COLLEGE THROUGH ACCOUNTS PAYABLE. QUALIFICATION AND USE OF THESE PAYMENTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPECTIVE DEPARTMENTS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DISBURSEMENT.

Shorter University participates in the student financial assistance programs through the U.S. Department of Education. Funds are awarded and applied to student accounts based on the Department of Education guidelines set forth by the Title IV programs.

MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN U.S. ALL GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED BY AT LEAST TWO DIFFERENT DEPARTMENTS WHICH CREATES CHECKS AND BALANCES TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS ARE TRACKED, REPORTED AND USED AS REQUIRED IN THE GRANT LANGUAGE. TITLE IV GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT VIA FINANCIAL AID TRANSMITTAL. AS STUDENTS COMPLETE THEIR REQUIREMENTS FOR RECEIVING AID, WEEKLY TRANSMITTALS ARE RUN AND STUDENTS, WITH THE PROPER CODING ARE SELECTED TO RECEIVE AID. THE TRANSMITTAL GENERATES A LISTING OF EACH AWARD, BY TYPE WITH TOTALS, AND IS USED TO RECORD THE GRANT EXPENSE TO THE GENERAL LEDGER. FEDERAL AWARDS AND GRANTS ARE VERIFIED TO A RECEIVABLE IN THE GENERAL LEDGER THAT IS RECORDED FROM AN AUTHORIZATION LETTER AND TO THE AVAILABLE BALANCE IN THE G5 PAYMENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. IF THE AVAILABLE BALANCE IS SUFFICIENT, THE FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN THROUGH THE G5 PAYMENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM INTO THE FEDERAL FUNDS CHECKING ACCOUNT. A BANK ACH REPORT IS GENERATED TO VERIFY THAT THE FUNDS ARE RECEIVED. THE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS ARE VERIFIED TO GRANTS BY TYPE ON THE FINANCIAL AID SYSTEM AND BILLING TRANSACTIONS ON THE BILLING FILE. THESE SYSTEMS ARE RECONCILED ON A MONTHLY BASIS.
College financial aid is administered and awarded for students attending Roanoke College by the college's Financial Aid office using the college's policies and procedures.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANT FUNDS ARE GIVEN TO THE FILING ORGANIZAION'S SUPPORTING/CONTROLLED ORGANIZATION.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: STUDENTS ARE THE RECIPIENTS OF THE GRANT ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS. GRANT ASSISTANCE IS THEN MONITORED QUARTERLY TO ENSURE CRITERIA FOR SELECTION IS MAINTAINED.
GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENTS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, CHARLES R. DREW UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS.
Students seeking financial aid must file a FAFSA to determine their eligibility and need for grant and scholarship assistance.

FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED CONSISTENT WITH FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. FEDERAL PROGRAMS ARE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDIT. THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICES MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. VARIOUS CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE FUNDING SOURCE.

WAGNER COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES BY ENSURING THAT ALL STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIP MONIES ARE ALWAYS REGISTERED AS STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE. MANY DEPARTMENTS WITHIN THE COLLEGE WORK IN CONJUNCTION TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE MONITORED EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY. THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE REVIEWS ALL STUDENT APPLICATIONS, AND DETERMINES WHO IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS. THE FINANCE AND BUSINESS OFFICE DRAWS DOWN FUNDS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS, AND THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE MONITORS AND MAINTAINS ALL RECORDS REGARDING THE REGISTERED STATUS OF STUDENTS. PART III, LINE 1, COLUMN B WAGNER COLLEGE ESTIMATES THAT APPROXIMATELY 90% OF ALL FULL-TIME STUDENTS RECEIVE SOME SORT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM THE COLLEGE. THEREFORE, THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS OF GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE BY WAGNER COLLEGE IS ESTIMATED BY TAKING 90% OF THE TOTAL FTE ENROLLMENT FOR THE FALL 2018 SEMESTER (2,001 FTES), RESULTING IN APPROXIMATELY 1,801 RECIPIENTS.

Ministries interested in having their project selected as an ORU missions project submit a Missions Project Proposal. The ORU Mission's Committee meets and approves of projects and numbers them according to their urgency of completion. Ministries are notified when funds have been collected to disburse the pledged amount to the missions project designation. Each ministry is required to send proof to the administrative liaison once the missions project is completed. This proof comes in forms such as photos and video testimonials. The administrative liaison reports this information back to the ORU Missions Committee. Scholarships/fellowships are applied directly to student accounts. No cash changes hands.

SCHEDULE I, PART 1, LINE 2 PACIFIC UNIVERSITY AWARDS FEDERAL AND STATE AID ONLY TO U.S. CITIZENS AND ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS. ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS ARE DEFINED AS THOSE LIVING IN THE U.S. FOR "OTHER THAN A TEMPORARY PURPOSE THEY CAN POSSESS A VARIETY OF DOCUMENTS WHICH DEMONSTRATE THAT STATUS, INCLUDING I-551S AND I-94S WITH CERTAIN STAMPS. APPLICANTS WHO FILE A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) HAVE THEIR FAFSA DATA MATCHED WITH DATA IN SEVERAL FEDERAL DATABASES, INCLUDING THE SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION AND THE DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY. WHEN THOSE DATABASE MATCHES ARE NOT SUCCESSFUL, WE OBTAIN DOCUMENTATION FROM THE APPLICANTS TO ENSURE THAT WE ARE AWARDING FEDERAL AND STATE AID ONLY TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS. THAT DOCUMENTATION BECOMES PART OF THEIR FINANCIAL AID FILES AND IS RETAINED FOR AT LEAST FIVE YEARS. ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS MUST ALSO BE OREGON RESIDENTS TO RECEIVE STATE AID. INSTITUTIONAL AID ONLY IS AWARDED TO CERTAIN INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS WHO ARE IN THE U.S. SOLELY OR PRIMARILY TO PURSUE POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION. ON AN ON-GOING BASIS, STAFF IN FINANCIAL AID AND BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS THE ACTIVITY OF ALL AWARDING AND DISBURSEMENT ACTIVITY OF AWARDS AND LOANS ON A MONTHLY BASIS AT A MINIMUM. ANY DIFFERENCES OR ANOMALIES ARE INVESTIGATED IMMEDIATELY AND, IF NEEDED, CORRECTED.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS: THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID PROCESSES ALL STUDENTS' FINANCIAL AID AWARDS BASED ON GUIDELINES SET FORTH BY FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS. THESE AWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THE STUDENT FINANCIAL PACKAGE AND ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS ONCE ALL ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE MET. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID RECONCILES ALL FEDERAL FUNDS TO THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION COMMON ORIGINATION AND DISBURSEMENT SYSTEM ON A MONTHLY BASIS. IN ADDITION, THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE RECONCILES THE AWARD DISBURSEMENT ACTIVITIES POSTED TO THE INSTITUTE'S GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNT TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE LEDGERS AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDS REPORTS. THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE ALSO PROCESSES THE REIMBURSEMENT REQUESTS AND RECONCILIATION OF FUNDS RECEIVED, AND MONITORS THE SPENDING LEVEL TO ENSURE THAT ACTUAL DISBURSEMENTS DOES NOT EXCEED THE AUTHORIZED GOVERNMENT GRANT.
MENLO COLLEGE REQUIRES FINANCIAL AID APPLICANTS SUBMIT EVIDENCE OF ELIGIBILITY AND MAINTAINS ONGOING RECORDS OF ATTENDANCE AND SCHOLASTIC ACHIEVEMENTS BY ALL RECIPIENTS.

The University's Office of Student Financial Services awards all Federal and State Financial aid grants in accordance with the Federal and State regulations. Donor restricted grants are awarded in accordance with the donor's wishes.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO TUITION AND FEES INCURRED AT THE UNIVERSITY AND NOT PAID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS. MONITORING CONSISTS OF RECORD KEEPING FOR INTERNAL USE AND REVIEW OF ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III, LINE 1F:
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IN CONFORMANCE WITH ESTABLISHED POLICIES ON THE BASIS OF BOTH NEED AND SCHOLASTIC MERIT. TUITION DISCOUNTING IS BASED ON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY APU'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. AWARDS TO STUDENTS WITH NEED ARE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID FILED WITH THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR. THE APU APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION CONTAINS INFORMATION UTILIZED FOR SCHOLARSHIP AWARD. AID IS DETERMINED AND AWARDED ON AN EQUAL BASIS TO RECIPIENTS WITH SIMILAR ATTRIBUTES. PART III(B) NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS: RECIPIENTS HAVE RECEIVED ONE OR MORE AWARDS FOR WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE.
The grants and/or financial assistance provided to the students are applied directly to the student's account, ensuring that the funds are used as intended.

MONITORING PROCEDURES PART II: GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR FINANCIAL AFFAIRS. RESPONSIBILITY CENTER HEADS WITHIN THE UNIVERSITY ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THE GENERAL USE OF UNIVERSITY FUNDS FOR APPROVED USES. DISBURSEMENT REQUESTS FOR GRANT FUNDS MUST BE APPROVED BY THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM (FAIS) ACCOUNT ADMINISTRATOR OR THE HEAD OF THE RESPONSIBILITY CENTER. WHEN THE REQUESTOR IS ALSO THE FAIS ACCOUNT ADMINISTRATOR OR THE HEAD OF THE RESPONSIBILITY CENTER, THE GRANT FUNDING REQUEST MUST BE SIGNED BY THE NEXT HIGHER LEVEL ADMINISTRATOR. THE UNIVERSITY'S DISBURSEMENT PROCESS IDENTIFIES AND RECORDS PAYMENTS TO BOTH U.S. AND FOREIGN INDIVIDUALS/ENTITIES. THE UNIVERSITY EMPLOYS APPROPRIATE MEASURES TO REDUCE THE RISK THAT ANY GRANT FUNDING PROVIDED IS NOT USED FOR NON-CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR EXPLOITATION BY TERRORIST ORGANIZATIONS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, UNIVERSITY ATTENDANCE AND/OR PARTICIPATION AT SPONSORED EVENTS AND ONGOING REVIEWS OF THE SPECIALLY DESIGNATED NATIONALS LIST PUBLISHED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY. FOR RESEARCH SUBCONTRACTS,THE INITIAL DETERMINATION OF ELIGIBILITY AND APPROPRIATENESS OF THE ENTITY LIES JOINTLY BETWEEN THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI)/DEPARTMENT AND THE OFFICE OF RESEARCH. THE PI/DEPARTMENT IDENTIFIES THE ENTITY USUALLY BASED UPON THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF THE PI EVIDENCED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK. DOCUMENTATION IS OBTAINED FROM THE ENTITY WHICH IS REVIEWED. UPON SUBMISSION, THE OFFICE OF RESEARCH LOOKS FOR THIS DOCUMENTATION SO THAT IT MEETS SPONSOR AND UNIVERSITY REQUIREMENTS. IF AND WHEN THE PROJECT IS FUNDED, THE DEPARTMENT INITIATES A SUBCONTRACT REQUEST. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: MONITORING PROCEDURES PART III GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE INSTITUTION DOES MAINTAIN RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE. THE RECORDS, ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA ARE MAINTAINED BY EITHER THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID, THE STUDENTS' SCHOOL DEPARTMENT, THE BENEFITS SECTION OF HUMAN RESOURCES, OR THE FACULTY RECORDS OFFICE. GRANT FUNDS THAT ARE RESTRICTED IN THEIR USE AND ARE NOT REFUNDABLE IN CASH TO THE STUDENTS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT SYSTEM. GRANTS THAT ARE NOT RESTRICTED IN THEIR USE AND ARE REFUNDABLE TO THE STUDENTS ARE NOT MONITORED.
THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REFLECTS THE ACTUAL NUMBER OF STUDENTS AND EMPLOYEES WHO RECEIVED THE ASSISTANCE.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK.
