THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

Keck Graduate Institute awards scholarships only to individual graduate students enrolled at the Institute. The scholarships are awarded in the admissions process based upon academic merit, financial need, and availability of funds. The Institute monitors that each student receiving a scholarship maintains satisfactory academic progress. In awarding donor-funded scholarships, the Institute also monitors that students selected for those scholarships meet any donor stipulations as to academic preparation or field of study.

STUDENTS MAY BE AWARDED GRANT FUNDS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. IN EACH CASE THE STUDENT CAN RETAIN ELIGIBILITY FOR FUNDING FOR AS MANY AS EIGHT SEMESTERS AS A FULL-TIME STUDENT, PROVIDED THE STUDENT MEETS THE RENEWAL CRITERIA SUCH AS GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND GRADE PROCESSION AS OUTLINED IN THE UNIVERSITY CATALOGUE. INDIVIDUAL AWARD AMOUNTS ARE BASED UPON THE STUDENTS' COST TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY IN A GIVEN ACADEMIC YEAR. FACTORS INCLUDED IN THE CALCULATED COST INCLUDE TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD, AND ESTIMATES FOR THE COST OF BOOKS AND PERSONAL EXPENSES DURING THE NINE MONTH ACADEMIC YEAR. AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT MAY NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THE COST OF TUITION FROM THE INSTITUTIONAL GRANT FUNDS.

GRANT FUNDS ARE ADMINISTERED IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE APPLICABLE REGULATIONS. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED ACCORDING TO ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA INCLUDING SCHOLASTIC ABILITY, CHRISTIAN INVOLVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR TALENT. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ACCOUNTED FOR IN SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS WHICH ARE RECONCILED INTERNALLY. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AUDITED ANNUALLY IN COMPLIANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133.
THE UNIVERSITY FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON DOE TITLE IV REGULATIONS AND UNIVERSITY APPROVED POLICIES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE UTILIZES SYSTEMS DESIGNED FOR FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS AND MONITORS THE ACTIVITY AND USES OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GRANTS FUNDS WITH THE APPROPRIATE CRITERIA ON AN ONGOING BASIS.
Grants are awarded to individuals based on compliance with eligibility requirements. Award grant and assistance amounts are applied by the University to the student tuition billing.

ALL GRANTS REPRESENT INTERNAL TRANSFER OF FUNDS FROM ENDOWMENTS OR OTHER ACCOUNTS TO A REVENUE ACCOUNT FOR TUITION PAYMENTS. NO FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO INDIVIDUALS. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND SMU GRANT LEVELS ARE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S ENTERING GPA AND NEED. FOR INCOMING FRESHMAN, TEST SCORES ARE ALSO A FACTOR. PROVIDED THAT EACH STUDENT MAINTAINS THE REQUIRED GPA, DOES NOT EXCEED THE MAXIMUM TIMEFRAME FOR INSTITUTIONAL AID AND SUBMITS EITHER A FAFSA OR FAFSA WAIVER BY THE MARCH 1ST DEADLINE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ELIGIBLE FOR HIS/ HER MERIT SCHOLARSHIP OR SMU GRANT.

The Student Financial Services Department maintains records to substantiate eligibility and election criteria for students receiving awards and scholarships. Departments maintain records of selection criteria and eligibility for recipients of stipends and other awards. All payments are uploaded to their respective categories. The business office reconciles accounts and prepares departmental and grantor reports. Awards are applied directly to student accounts and no cash changes hands.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS ELIGIBLITY REQUIREMENTS AND MONITORS GRANTING OF AWARDS TO STUDENTS AND FOLLOWS U.S. FEDERAL AID REGULATIONS AND ALL STATES' REGULATIONS FOR GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges finanical aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING MCPHERSON COLLEGE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE NON-CASH AWARDS, REQUIRING THE AWARDS TO BE USED AS A DIRECT REDUCTION IN TUITION COST.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO ENROLLED STUDENTS. AMOUNTS AWARDED ARE DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE COLLEGE'S AND FEDERAL AGENCY POLICIES. AMOUNTS GIVEN ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCESS FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE UNIVERSITY MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE THREE MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID, AND FINANCING ALTERNATIVES. THE STUDENT FIRST APPLIES FOR ASSISTANCE, AND THEN BASED ON THE GRANT CRITERIA (FINANCIAL AND ENROLLMENT), THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AWARDS THE GRANT MONIES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE TOTAL AMOUNTS GIVEN BY GRANT.
All assistance is in the form of grants and scholarships. These funds are applied directly to the student's account.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS TO LONGWOOD UNIVERSITY ARE COORDINATED WITH UNIVERSITY PERSONNEL AND EITHER REIMBURSEMENT IN NATURE OR GENERAL SUPPORT FOR UNIVERSITY OPERATIONS WITH NO CONTINUING NEED TO MONITOR USE OF FUNDS. GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS OUTSIDE THE UNIVERSITY ARE TYPICALLY SPECIAL IN NATURE AND USE OF FUNDS HAVE BEEN AGREED TO FOR A SPECIAL PURPOSE PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS.

The University's Office of Financial Aid monitors all recipients of scholarship awards to determine both initial and continuing eligibility based on the criteria for each type of award, which may include academic performance, financial need, criteria established by donors of endowed scholarship funds, etc.

MONITOR THE USE OF GRANTS FUNDS IN THE US: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO BOSTON PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY, AS PART OF THE CITY OF BOSTON, WHICH ASSISTS THE ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP DOWNTOWN BOSTON AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS PURSUANT TO COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO CAMBRIDGE STREET DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, A 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION, WHICH ASSISTS THE ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP THE CAMBRIDGE STREET AREA OF THE CITY OF BOSTON. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO EAST BOSTON HIGH SCHOOL FOR ITS ATHLETIC PROGRAMS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE FUND FOR PARKS AND RECREATION IN BOSTON FOR UPKEEP OF ATHLETIC FIELDS USED BY THE UNIVERSITY AS WELL AS THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS. ALL GRANTS AWARDED ARE BASED ON NEED AND/OR MERIT AND CONFORM TO FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON A THOROUGH REVIEW AND VERIFICATION OF A FAMILY'S INCOME, ASSETS, SIZE, AND NUMBER OF DEPENDENTS ENROLLED IN COLLEGE. ANNUAL EXPENDITURE REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS FOR REVIEW. THE FUND EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE IN AN ANNUAL AUDIT CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM.

To ensure our grants and scholarships are used for proper purpose the financial Aid Office performs regular maintenance and reconciliation with our Bursar's Office monitoring that all funds awarded to a particular student are being properly credited to their student account. Any changes or adjustments to original award that affect grant and scholarship funding are documented, saved and then copied to our Bursar's Office. These processes are completed utilizing an automated software system which allows us to generate reports at any time for monitoring and reconciliation purposes. Additionally, we have a yearly audit performed by an outside accounting firm guaranteeing we are staying in compliance with all federal, state, and institutional policies and procedures as well as assuring funding is being used as intended.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and stipends are available to undergraduate students and graduate students through the admissions process. Once awarded, depending on the type of aid, payment is credited to either the student account or directly to the student. All payments are monitored and approved by the Financial Services department before payment is applied or paid to the student. All students receiving scholarships and stipends have been selected on a non-discriminatory basis. Faculty enrichment grant opportunities are available to full-time and part-time faculty teaching in a degree program. Selections are based on the merit of the proposal and reviewed by members of a selection committee. Payment are monitored by the Dean's office and all payments are approved by the Vice Provost and School Finance department before payment is made.

THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT AWARD GRANTS BUT PROVIDES OTHER ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF CONTRIBUTIONS AND NON-CASH CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE UNIVERSITY AND ITS EDUCATION FOUNDATION AS SUPPORT FOR THE UNIVERSTIY AS OUR 509(A)(3) STATUS REQUIRES.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED AS A CREDIT TO THE STUDENT TO COVER CHARGES OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND OTHER FEES RELATED TO THE COST OF ATTENDANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Phoenix Seminary, Inc. students must submit applications for specific scholarships available each semester. Once the scholarship applications are submitted, the scholarship committee reviews and scores the applications based on the answers provided by the students. The scholarship committee then awards the scholarships based on the students meeting the scholarship criteria. Scholarships are disbursed based on the amount of funds available and the number of students meeting the scholarship criteria that apply.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: FURMAN PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY. THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND AID FOR SUCH STUDENTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT AND COVER THE COSTS OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. THE SCHOLARSHIP AND/OR FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON INSTITUTIONAL POLICY AND STANDARDS SET FORTH BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE COMPLIANCE WITH SUCH REGULATIONS. THE SCHOLARSHIP AND/OR FINANCIAL AID IS APPLIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITH THE UNIVERSITY AS A REDUCTION IN FEES. AS A RESULT, THE GRANT CAN ONLY BE USED FOR ITS INTENDED PURPOSE (I.E. COST OF ATTENDANCE) AND CANNOT BE DIVERTED FROM THIS USE. OTHER TYPES OF GRANTS PROVIDED CONSIST OF RESEARCH, INTERNSHIP OR FELLOWSHIP GRANTS TO STUDENTS. SUCH GRANTS ARE GIVEN AND MONITORED BY THE ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT GIVING THE GRANT OR THE UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH AND INTERNSHIP DEPARTMENT. SPONSORSHIPS PAID TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE MADE UNDER WRITTEN AGREEMENTS BETWEEN THE PARTIES AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY EVENTS AND PROVIDE A PRESENCE FOR FURMAN IN THE AREA. COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IS A SIGNIFICANT ASPECT OF THE FURMAN ADVANTAGE. THESE SPONSORSHIPS WITH GREENVILLE BUSINESSES THEREFORE SERVE TO ADVANCE THE FURMAN ADVANTAGE FOR OUR STUDENTS AND THE COMMUNITY.
ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DETERIMINED BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE DONOR OR INSTITUTION.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCE OFFICE AND SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE MAINTAIN A RECORD OF ALL COMMITTEE AUTHORIZED AND EXECUTIVE OFFICE APPROVED SCHOLARSHIPS, THE AWARD LETTERS, AND THE FINAL ENROLLMENT REPORTS, INDICATING THE PARTICIPANT'S NAME, COURSE AND DOLLAR AMOUNT OF THE AWARD. THESE RECORDS ARE THEN COMPARED TO THE OFFICE CLASS ROSTER TO VERIFY COURSE ATTENDANCE AND SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: TO RECEIVE A STIPEND, THE INDIVIDUAL MUST BE A STUDENT AND MEET THE REQUIRED GUIDELINE FROM THE AWARDING AGENCY. EACH DEPARTMENT CHAIR VERIFIES THAT THE STUDENT MEETS THE AWARDING AGENCY'S GUIDELINES. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS THE PAYMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON SPECIFIC GUIDELINES CREATED BY THE SOURCE OF FUNDING. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY AND MONITORS USE OF FUNDS.

Grants are made to students currently attending the Seminary to enable them to live and study near the Puritan Reformed Theological Seminary. The Seminary is aware of the needs of the students and is able to monitor the use of the funds provided.

A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF INSTITUTIONAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS IS BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT, FOR WHICH THE UNIVERSITY HAS A PREDETERMINED GRID THAT PROVIDES THE AMOUNTS TO BE AWARDED BASED ON THE STUDENT'S ACTUAL GPA AND TEST SCORES AND, AS NEEDED, EVALUATION BY THE UNIVERSITY'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. OTHER INSTITUTIONAL AID CONSISTS OF RETURNED MISSIONARY SCHOLARSHIPS, TALENT, AND OTHER NEED-BASED GRANTS. RETURNED MISSIONARY SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,500 PER YEAR TO ALL FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHO HAVE COMPLETED A MISSION FOR THE CHURCH OF JESUS CHRIST OF LATTER-DAY SAINTS OR SIMILAR SERVICE. TALENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED IN VARIOUS AMOUNTS, TYPICALLY BETWEEN $500 AND $2,000 PER STUDENT, AND ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE NOMINATION OF THE UNIVERSITY FACULTY, ART/THEATRE/MUSIC DIRECTOR, ETC. AND APPROVAL OF THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE. UNIVERSITY NEED BASED GRANTS AND VARIOUS OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED AS DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR. FEDERAL & STATE GRANTS, INCLUDING PELL, SEOG, AND VTAG ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND MEET THE VARIOUS QUALIFICATIONS. FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS ARE VERIFIED INTERNALLY BY OUR FINANCIAL AID STAFF AS DICTATED BY APPLICABLE REGULATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WISCONSIN SCHOOL OF PROFESSIONAL PSYCHOLOGY OFFERS A MINORITY SCHOLARSHIP AND VARIOUS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFIED INCOMING STUDENTS. ELIGIBILITY FOR THE MINORITY SCHOLARSHIP IS BASED UPON MINORITY STATUS, PROVEN ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL NEED. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVMENTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON EITHER THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA OF THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING, ACADEMIC MERIT, OR TALENT. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS SCHOLARSHIP FUND AVAILABILITY, MAKES SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS, AND MAINTAINS AN ON-GOING AWARENESS OF STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.
The College manages Federal Title IV grant and loan funds in accordance with Title IV regulations. The College undergoes an annual A-133 audit to monitor the use of these funds.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR ALLOCATIONS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A VARIETY OF REQUIREMENTS THAT ARE RELATIVE ONLY TO THE PARTICULAR TYPE OF AWARD TO BE GRANTED. VARIOUS SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR ALLOCATIONS CAN BE AWARDED BASED ON THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT, THE STUDENT'S YEAR IN SCHOOL, OR ANY OTHER REQUIREMENT THAT MAY BE SPECIFICALLY NOTED IN AN ENDOWMENT.
THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIES WITH ALL CONTRACTUAL AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS WHEN DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.
THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AT EACH CAMPUS IS GIVEN AN AMOUNT THAT MAY BE AWARDED AT THEIR CAMPUS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR, WITH A CHART OF HOW MANY STUDENTS AND THE AMOUNT FOR EACH TERM.

INSTITUTIONAL MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE AND PROMISE FOR FUTURE SUCCESS AT THE COLLEGE. WHILE A NUMBER OF FACTORS ARE CONSIDERED, THE COLLEGE RELIES HEAVILY ON THE EVALUATION OF HIGH SCHOOL COURSEWORK, HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGES AND CLASS RANK, STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES, WRITTEN WORK AND LETTERS OF RECOMMENDATION. EXTRACURRICULAR INVOLVEMENT THAT DEMONSTRATES A PROMISE FOR SUCCESS AT THE COLLEGIATE LEVEL IS ALSO CONSIDERED. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR PAYMENT TOWARD TUITION, ROOM, BOARD AND FEES.

ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED UPON ENROLLMENT AND ELIGIBILITY IS FOR THE EIGHT SEMESTERS. AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER, THE FINANCIAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT VERIFIES SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS HAS BEEN MAINTAINED IN ORDER TO DETERMINE CONTINUATION OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES A STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY BASED ON THE FAMILY'S FINANCIAL STRENGTH, WHICH INCLUDES CONSIDERATION OF FAMILY INCOME AND ASSETS, NUMBER OF CHILDREN IN COLLEGE AND, IF APPROPRIATE, SPECIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. FINANCIAL AID WILL BE REVOKED WITHOUT ADEQUATE PROGRESS.
CWS awards are allocated back to wages as required by IPEDs reporting.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ISSUES GRANTS TO QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS. THE GRANT FUNDS ARE THEN USED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AS PAYMENT TOWARDS HIS OR HER COLLEGE EDUCATION.

The College follows federal guidelines for determining the financial need of each student. The College Board Profile and the FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid) provides information to determine financial need. Grants and scholarships are awarded based on the demonstrated need of each student. The College has a Town Gown Committee which awards small grants to local community organizations based on submitted proposals. The total amount of such grants is less than $100,000.

The Organization provided different aids to individuals and families, such as food, clothes, medicals, and money to pay for utilities, etc., which no individual totaled more than $5,000.00 per the year. The total was $56,800.88 for different individuals and families and there was no individual total more than $5,000.00 that needed to be reported.

HAVERFORD COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED SOLELY ON NEED. HAVERFORD DOES NOT AWARD ANY GRANT AID BASED ON MERIT. APPLICANTS CAN BE ASKED TO FILE THE COLLEGE BOARD PROFILE AND THE FAFSA. IF ELIGIBLE FOR FEDERAL AID, PARENT AND STUDENT PERSONAL AND BUSINESS TAX RETURNS MUST BE PROVIDED. SUPPLEMENTS FOR BUSINESS AND FORMS FOR NON-CUSTODIAL PARENTS MAY ALSO BE REQUIRED BASED ON CIRCUMSTANCES. STUDENTS MAY APPEAL AWARD DECISIONS TO THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE INCLUDING THE VICE PRESIDENT AND DEAN OF ADMISSION AND FINANCIAL AID, THE DEAN OF THE COLLEGE, AND THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT FOR ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCE. HAVERFORD SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR TUITION, ROOM, BOARD, FEES AND OTHER BILLED CHARGES. SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATION OPPORTUNITY GRANTS (SEOG) ARE AWARDED BASED ON FAMILY CONTRIBUTION. ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA AND REGULATIONS DETERMINED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. PER THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION REGULATIONS, STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE PELL GRANTS MUST BE PROVIDED SEOG FUNDS FIRST. IF THE STUDENT IS SELECTED TO RECEIVE THESE AWARDS OTHER VERIFICATION FORMS MAY BE REQUIRED INCLUDING THE VERIFICATION STATEMENT, PARENT AND STUDENT TAX RETURNS, AND NON-TAX FILER STATEMENTS. SEOG AWARDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT FOR TUITION, ROOM, BOARD AND OTHER BILLED CHARGES. SEOG AWARDS ARE AUDITED ANNUALLY BY THE COLLEGE'S OUTSIDE AUDITORS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE SINGLE AUDIT.

Robert Morris University Illinois provides a number of grants/scholarship awards to eligible students based on various criteria such as financial need, merit, academic ability, academic major, and location of attendance. This gift assistance is support by two important sources: the University reserves a portion of its budget for grants/scholarships, and financial support is contributed by faculty, staff, alumni and friends of the University.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK WITHIN FOURTEEN DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

MEREDITH COLLEGE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OFFICE HAS SYSTEMS AND INTERNAL PROCEDURES IN PLACE THAT ENSURES THE PROPER DETERMINATION, DISBURSEMENT AND MONITORING OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SYSTEMS AND PROCEDURES COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL STUDENT TITLE IV AID REGULATIONS, NORTH CAROLINA STATE EDUCATION ASSISTANCE AUTHORITY RULES, AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES.

CLAREMONT LINCOLN UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH GUIDELINES SET FORTH BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. CLU ENSURES THAT ALL STUDENTS ARE QUALIFIED TO RECEIVE SUCH ASSISTANCE. ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED THROUGH DIRECT REDUCTION TO TUITION FOR STUDENTS.

All University spending must be approved by a manager or higher level, depending on the amount of the expenditure. Any expenditure of $1,000 or above would have to be approved by a Dean or other budget center manager. An expenditure in excess of $10,000 must be approved by a Vice President (or that person's designee) or the President. Grants or assistance to outside organizations are segregated in the University's financial accounting system through the use of a separate account code, which allows for review by University's central Finance Department. Scholarships are provided to students who are required to matriculate in the University, thereby ensuring that the funds are expended for the intended purposes.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part II, Line 2, (h) Purpose of grant assistance:
ExplntnTxt: South Orange Performing Arts Center, Inc. (SOPAC) - Construction of South Orange Performing Arts Center.

MONITORING THE EXPENDITURES OF GRANT FUNDS IS DONE IN ACCORDANCE WITH STONE CHILD COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES MANUAL, SECTION III - FINANCIAL. ALSO, AS A CONDITION FOR RECEIPT OF GRANT FUNDS, THE COLLEGE MUST ALLOCATE THESE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF EACH SPECIFIC FEDERAL GRANT AND ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS FOR USES OF THESE FUNDS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE PROVIDES FISCAL OVERSIGHT FOR ALL FINANCIAL AFFAIRS TO ENSURE THAT THESE FUNDS ARE BEING USED IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. THE APPROVAL PROCESS FOR ALL EXPENDITURES REQUIRE THREE SIGNATURES: THE PERSON REQUESTING THE USE OF FUNDS, THE PROJECT COORDINATOR/DIRECTOR, THEN THE PRESIDENT HAS THE FINAL APPROVAL. A MONTHLY EXPENDITURE REPORT FOR ALL PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY THE COLLEGE AND A MONTHLY CHECK REGISTER IS PROVIDED TO THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW AND APPROVAL AT THEIR MONTHLY MEETINGS.
Financial aid assistance is awarded based on US Federal, State, and Private guidelines as required by the corresponding type of assistance.

A LIST OF SCHOLARSHIP AND FELLOWSHIP RECIPIENTS IS ON FILE AT ST. JOHN COLLEGE AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE COLLEGE RUNS AN ACADEMIC PROGRESS REPORT EVERY YEAR TO DETERMINE EACH STUDENT'S AID ELIGIBILITY. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED TO PERSONS HAVING INTEREST IN THE INSTITUTION, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The Financial Aid Office and Business Office operate together to ensure grants are used for educational purposes. Grants are applied to students' accounts by the Business Office after the grants are approved and disbursed by the Financial Aid Office.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: CAMPBELL UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT PROGRAMS. ALL GRANT PROGRAMS INCLUDE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AND FUND MANAGEMENT REGULATIONS AND GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED ACCORDING TO EACH PROGRAM'S GUIDELINES ONCE ELIGIBILITY HAS BEEN DETERMINED FOR THAT FUND. ELIGIBILITY IS REVIEWED BEFORE TRANSMITTAL/DISBURSEMENT TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. EACH FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAM HAS PREDETERMINED REPORTING GUIDELINES AND STANDARDS. THE FUNDS ARE RECONCILED AND FUND BUDGETS ARE REVIEWED MONTHLY.
GETTYSBURG COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE DESCRIBED ON SCHEDULE F, PART V.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE BASED ON NEED AND/OR MERIT. THE COLLEGE MONITORS STUDENTS' FILES TO ENSURE THAT THE STUDENT RECEIVES NECESSARY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON GRADES, COURSE OF STUDY AND FINANCIAL NEED. ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE REQUIRED TO BE USED TO DEFRAY THE COSTS OF ATTENDANCE; FUNDS MAY NOT BE SPENT ON DISCRETIONARY ITEMS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Institutional need and merit awards, government grants and outside scholarships provided aid to 4,189 students during the year. Federally subsidized loans are awarded to eligible students based on need. Over $20 million was paid directly to students (Form 990, Part III, line 4a) with the remainder applied internally to tuition, fees, and room and board.

GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS STUDENT TUITION ACCOUNTS FOR ANY STUDENT WHO RECEIVED A SCHOLARSHIP OR TUITION CREDIT. THE BURSAR'S OFFICE AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ENSURE THAT STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS OR TUITION CREDITS MAINTAIN FULL-TIME OR PART-TIME STUDENT STATUS AND MEET ALL OTHER REQUIREMENTS, AS REQUIRED BY THE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIP, SO THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.
Financial Aid Assistance are awarded based on US, State, and private guidelines as required by the type or source of assistance.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - CLEVELAND INSTITUTE OF MUSIC CREDITS THE GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AND THEREFORE ENSURES THAT THE FUNDS ARE SPENT FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. WORK-STUDY AND AUDITION ASSISTANCE ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS WHEN EARNED OR INCURRED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE; THESE SCHOLARSHIPS MAY ONLY BE USED BY STUDENTS TO DEFRAY THE COSTS OF TUITION AND/OR ROOM AND BOARD. SINCE THE STUDENTS MAY NOT EXERCISE ANY DISCRETION ON HOW THE FUNDS ARE SPENT, THE COLLEGE IS NOT REQUIRED TO MONITOR THE GRANTS (OTHER THAN TO ENSURE THAT THE STUDENT IS FULFILLING THE REQUIREMENTS FOR EARNING THE SCHOLARSHIP).
Financial aid to students.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY VALIDATING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS COMPLETION OF EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

Financial aid awards are granted to students based on the general criteria for institutional financial aid. No cash changes hands as financial aid is applied directly to student accounts through the college's academic management system.

The Office of Financial Aid maintain records to substantiate the amount of the grants or assistance disbursed to students, the students' eligibility for the grants or assistance, and the selection criteria used to award the grants or assistance.

The University awards grants, scholarships & student loans based on various, predefined criteria. Students must qualify for the assistance. Student enrollment and continuing eligibility are verified on an ongoing basis. Any amounts in excess of $600.00 are reported on Form 1098-T. No cash changes hands and funds are directly applied to student accounts.
Scholarships are awarded based on established criteria, including donor restrictions.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON ESTABLISHED FEDERAL AND COLLEGE POLICIES. AWARDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AT THE COLLEGE AS CREDITS TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES.

AWARDING OF INSTITUTIONAL AID IS DRIVEN BY THE AWARD THE STUDENT RECEIVES UPON ENTRANCE TO DAVIS COLLEGE. COMING IN AS A NEW STUDENT, THE ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE FIRST DETERMINES IF THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT BASED AWARDS. THESE AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC AND CO-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. EACH STUDENT IS THEN COMPARED TO A FINANCIAL AID AWARDING MATRIX WHICH IS COMPRISED OF VARYING NEED LEVELS FOR GRANT FUNDING, CAMPUS BASED AID AND CAMPUS EMPLOYMENT. STUDENTS ARE PLACED ON THIS GRID BY USING THE ADMISSIONS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA TO DETERMINE THEIR RATING AND THEN THEIR FINANCIAL NEED FACTOR AS DETERMINED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) FOR THAT ACADEMIC YEAR.

Student financial need is substantiated based on information provided in the Free Application for Federal Student Aid -- FAFSA. Additionally some aid is given based on High School GPA or standardized test (SAT or ACT) scores. Title IV funds are handled in accordance with applicable provisions. Student Financial Aid is treated as a reduction to tuition. The Financial Aid program is audited in compliance with the Federal OMB A-133 guidelines and no deficiencies were found during the time period covered by this filing.

Student financial aid is awarded after an application and verification process, using FAFSA for establishing financial need, GPA and recommendations to establish merit. Competitions and other award qualifications are used to determine eligibility where applicable. Records are maintained in the Financial Aid office; scholarships and awards are applied directly to student accounts.
THE SCHOLARSHIPS/FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS IS APPLIED AGAINST THEIR TUITION ACCOUNTS.
Keep Record of air tickets of persons participating in Bangladesh mission.

PART II - THE OFFICE OF THE CHANCELLOR MONITORS ALL FUNDS ALLOCATED TO EXTERNAL ORGANIZATIONS. PART III- THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS THAT ARE ALL APPLIED TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE BALANCES.
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A LISTING OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT.

Grants and aid are tracked in the accounting system in a temporarily restricted fund or reimbursed according to a qualified reimbursement policy. An audit of funds granted is conducted when deemed necessary. Grants and aid are applied directly to student accounts. Funds are given and monitored by the mission trip teams that are sent to work with Del Camino and Iteams each year. The funds are specifically used for the work done during the mission trips. The University's Admissions team monitors the use of funds.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid Eligibility Requirements * Complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) annually and as early as January 1 (Temple's priority deadline is March 1) * Sign statements on the FAFSA stating that: * you are not in default on a federal student loan and do not owe money on a federal student grant and * you will use federal student aid only for educational purposes * Comply with Temple University's Satisfactory Academic Progress Standards * Remain in good standing on educational loans and grants per the National Student Loan Database System (NSLDS) * Remain enrolled at least part-time per semester for Federal loans (6 credits as an undergraduate student and 4.5 credits as a graduate student) * Be enrolled in an eligible degree program at Temple University * Be a citizen or eligible non-citizen with a valid Social Security Number * Have a high school diploma or recognized equivalent * Be registered for the Selective Service if you are male and 18-25 years of age * Comply with any and all federal verification requests made by Student Financial Services Research Administration Processing an Award - Negotiation of SubAward(s) If the University receives an award and a portion of the activity is to be sub-contracted to another entity, Sponsored Programs assists the PI in development of a sub-contract which outlines the sub-contractor's role in meeting the requirements of the award. Sponsored Programs forwards the sub-contract to the sub-contractor for review and signature. Upon return of the executed document, the PI should complete a Financial Impact Statement. Sponsored Programs forwards the sub-contract and Financial Impact Statement to University Counsel, where review and appropriate signature(s) and seal (if necessary) are obtained. When the University is the recipient of a sub-contract similar procedures are followed.

ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS MADE BY ALLIANT EDUCATIONAL FOUNDATION ARE TO STUDENTS OR FACULTY OF ALLIANT INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY WHO HAVE COMPLETED AN APPLICATION PROCESS. THE AWARD IS BASED ON WRITTEN SELECTION CRITERIA. WORK STIPENDS ARE AWARDED TO GRADUATION STUDENTS OF ALLIANT INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY BASED ON QUALIFIED EMPLOYMENT PURSUANT TO GRANT CRITERIA. ONCE THE GRANTS ARE DISBURSED, EACH GRANT IS MONITORED ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS FOR CONTINUED COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT CRITERIA.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS ALL STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, OR OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE MONITORED THROUGHOUT THE AWARD, ACCEPTANCE, AND APPLICATION PROCESSES. APPROPRIATE RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED AND DOCUMENTED.

EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A SEPARATE DEPARTMENT ACCOUNT NUMBER. REPORTS ARE THEN PRINTED WHICH SHOW ALL FUNDS RECEIVED AND DISBURSED. THESE GRANT REPORTS ARE PRINTED ON A MONTHLY BASIS BY THE PERSON RESPONSIBLE FOR THE GRANT. THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT ALSO PRINTS GRANT REPORTS ON A MONTHLY BASIS AS A CHECK THAT DISBURSEMENTS ARE NOT GREATER THAN FUNDS RECEIVED AND THAT FUNDS ARE BEING DISBURSED FOR GRANTS APPROVED.
CITY UNIVERSITY OF SEATTLE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION. MONITORING IS DONE INTERNALLY TO ENSURE THE ACCOUNTS ARE CREDITED PROPERLY.
THE COLLEGE RECORDS AND TRACKS GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE.
THE TRUST DOCUMENT SPECIFIES THAT CERTAIN FUNDS ARE TO BE DISTRIBUTED TO OTHER TRUSTS AND TO THE COLLEGE.

PRESBYTERIAN COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, AND LOANS TO ITS STUDENTS. THE PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF THE FUNDS ARE PART OF THE FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES AND THEY ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE QUALIFICATIONS OF THE RECIPIENT. THE GUIDELINES ARE PUBLISHED IN THE PRESBYTERIAN COLLEGE ACADEMIC CATALOG AND COMPLY WITH THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS PUBLISHED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE SC DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE ALSO COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

ON SEPTEMBER 20, 2018, USDA ISSUED A GUIDE 1A TO SYNOVUS BANK AUTHORIZING INTERIM FINANCING FOR THESE AMOUNTS. AS A RESULT, SYNOVUS BANK ISSUED THE $60,420,000 ECONOMIC REVENUE BOND SERIES 2018 TO PCREF. AS A RESULT, PCREF ASSUMED RESPONSIBILITY FOR AND PAID OFF THE SERIES 2015 REVENUE BONDS AND ACQUIRED CAPITAL ASSETS WITH A NET BOOK VALUE OF APPROXIMATELY $37,300,000 FROM THE COLLEGE. THE DIFFERENCE IN ACQUIRED ASSETS AND ASSUMED OBLIGATIONS WAS RECORDED AS A CONTRIBUTION TO PCREF FROM THE COLLEGE OF APPROXIMATELY $6,400,000. AT JUNE 30, 2019, THERE WAS $43,688,101 OUTSTANDING ON THE ECONOMIC REVENUE BONDS SERIES 2018. THE USDA HAS GUARANTEED THE INTERIM FINANCING WITH SYNOVUS BANK. FUNDING BY THE USDA WILL BEGIN AT THE END OF PHASE 1 OF THE CONSTRUCTION PROJECT, ANTICIPATED FOR THE YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2021, AND WILL REFINANCE THE INTERIM FINANCING WITH SYNOVUS BANK WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE $5,000,000 COMMUNITY FACILITIES DIRECT LOAN, WHICH WILL REMAIN WITH SYNOVUS BANK.
THE COLLEGE OF THE MENOMINEE NATION FOLLOWS ITS POLICIES REGARDING GRANT APPLICANTS. GRANTS ARE FURTHER CONDITIONED ON SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.

THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN ITS PROGRAMS. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA, AS WELL AS PERFORMANCE IN ACADEMICS, LEADERSHIP, MUSIC, THEATRE AND ATHLETICS. TO BE CONSIDERED FOR SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE, STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR ADMISSION, SUBMIT ACADEMIC TRANSCRIPTS OF PRIOR EDUCATIONAL WORK AND SUBMIT TEST SCORES (ACT/SAT/CLT). FOR GRANT CONSIDERATION STUDENTS MUST ADDITIONALLY SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE RENEWABLE BASED ON MEETING PUBLISHED ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS. STUDENT PROGRESS IS MONITORED TO ENSURE THEY EARN A MINIMUM NUMBER OF CREDITS AND A MINIMUM GPA EACH ACADEMIC YEAR IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY.

BERKELEY DIVINITY SCHOOL MAINTAINS CERTAIN RESTRICTED ENDOWMENTS AND IS THE BENEFICIARY OF CERTAIN THIRD-PARTY TRUSTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIP AID TO STUDENTS. THE INCOME FROM THESE FUNDS IS PAID DIRECTLY TO YALE UNIVERSITY PER THE TERMS OF THE AFFILIATION AGREEMENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF YALE DIVINITY SCHOOL IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THE FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC MERIT OF STUDENTS, AND FOR MAKING ALL SCHOLARSHIP/FINANCIAL AID AWARDS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO FACULTY AND STUDENTS FROM OUTSIDE AGENCIES AND THE FUNDS ARE SENT DIRECTLY TO THE UNIVERSITY TO BE MANAGED. ORIGINAL RECEIPTS ARE SUBMITTED TO PROVIDE SUBSTANTIATION OF EXPENSES AND FINAL REPORTS ARE FORWARDED TO THE SPONSORS. SEE SCHEDULE O.

The financial aid office determines students eligibility for federal, state, and institutional scholarships according to the University's established criteria which follows federal and state guidelines for awarding any grant funds. There is an annual audit to ensure compliance with these regulations.

GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED UPON APPLICATIONS FILED WITH THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE (FOR RETURNING STUDENTS), AND WITH THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT FOR FIRST SEMESTER ENTERING STUDENTS. THE DETERMINATION AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS IS ON A MERIT OR NEED BASIS. THE DETERMINATION IS ALSO BASED UPON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS AND CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY A DONOR OR THE COLLEGE. THE SOURCES OF FUNDS COME FROM TUITION, ENDOWMENTS (EITHER RESTRICTED BY A DONOR OR RESTRICTED INTERNALLY BY THE COLLEGE), PRIVATE NON-ENDOWMENT GRANTS, OR GRANTS FROM THE STATE OF TEXAS. ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE REVIEWED MONTHLY AGAINST THE BUDGET AND DIFFERENCES ARE ANALYZED AND RECONCILED. AT THE END OF EACH FISCAL YEAR, THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FEDERAL GRANTS AWARDED ARE AUDITED BY AN EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. IN ADDITION, THE STATE GRANTS ARE SUBJECT TO A REVIEW OF PROCEDURES BY THE SAME FIRM.

GRANTEE SUBMITS ANNUAL FINANCIAL REPORTS, EACH REPORT INCLUDES SPENDING OF GTCNN FUNDS BY LINE ITEM, A BUDGET VARIANCE REPORT, REVENUES FROM OTHER SOURCES, AND TOTAL PROGRAM EXPENDITURES. AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, THE GRANTEE SUBMITS A FINAL REPORT.
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND/OR MERIT AS DETERMINED BY SEMINARY ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID PERSONNEL

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: BUTLER UNIVERSITY HAS WRITTEN QUALIFICATION CRITERIA FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AND FOLLOWS A WRITTEN APPROVAL PROCESS.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 1 AND 2 THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ISSUED ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION BALANCE; THEREFORE, THE STUDENT CAN EXERCISE NO DISCRETION IN THE USE OF THE FUNDS. SINCE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS DEFRAY COST OF TUITION, NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS IS REQUIRED. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 PROGRAM MANAGERS WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE GRANTEES RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS AND MONITOR THE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE GRANT AGREEMENT. MONITORING INCLUDES CONDUCTING REGULAR CONTACT/WORKING SESSIONS WITH THE GRANTEE OR DIRECT ASSISTANCE WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GRANT ACTIVITIES.

THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ISSUES AND MONITORS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AWARDS. THE FINANCE DIVISION MONITORS THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS REFLECTED ON STUDENT BILLING. STUDENT AID IS AWARDED ACCORDING TO THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES. STUDENT AID IS AWARDED BASED ON MEETING ESTABLISHED CRITERIA WHICH INCLUDE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING ALL FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID BY COMPLETING A FAFSA FORM WHICH CAPTURES THE DATA REQUIRED DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY BASED ON FEDERAL AND/OR STATE REGULATIONS. DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY IS KEPT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ON FILE IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. WHEN FUNDS ARE AWARDED, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S OPERATIONAL SYSTEM AID MODULE TO ENSURE THERE ARE NO CHANGES IN STATUS THAT MIGHT AFFECT THEIR ONGOING ELIGIBILITY. TOTAL GRANT FUNDS AWARDED ARE TRACKED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH AUTHORIZED AMOUNTS FROM THE FUNDING AGENCY. THE COLLEGE ALSO IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT AN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT A-133 AUDIT TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS FOR GRANT ASSISTANCE. THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING ALL INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE. CONTINUING STUDENTS APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIP AID BY COMPLETING A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION FORM WHICH CAPTURES THE DATA REQUIRED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY BASED ON INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. ENTERING STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED FOR SCHOLARSHIP BASED ON THE COLLEGE'S AUDITION AND INTERVIEW PROCESS. DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY IS KEPT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ON FILE IN THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE. WHEN FUNDS ARE AWARDED, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S OPERATIONAL SYSTEM SCHOLARSHIP MODULE TO ENSURE THERE ARE NO CHANGES IN STATUS THAT MIGHT AFFECT THEIR ONGOING ELIGIBILITY. TOTAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AWARDED ARE TRACKED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH BUDGETED AMOUNTS. THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE REVIEWS ALL AWARDS EACH SEMESTER TO DETERMINE THAT THE STUDENT IS STILL ELIGIBLE FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid is awarded to students by the office of Student Financial Aid in the Enrollment Services Division of the Student Affairs. The awards are based on factors including academic interest, demonstrated financial need and scholarly achievement that is made up to the student's financial need . Funds are provided by private donors (corporations, individuals and foundations) contributions or endowment funds, the Federal and State governments and also from the University's operating budget. Awards are monitored on an individual basis to ensure that awardees continue to maintain the criteria for qualification such as the minimum GPA, satisfactory academic progress and demonstrated need with adjustments to the aid made as appropriate.

VANGUARD UNIVERSITY AWARDS MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO TRADITIONAL UNDERGRADUATES AND MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO GRADUATE STUDENTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA INCLUDING ACADEMIC, TALENT AND PARTICIPATION, AND INCENTIVE INCLUDING DENOMINATION, MINISTRY/MISSIONARY DEPENDENT. CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY INCLUDING MAINTENANCE GPA IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. NEED-BASED AWARDS REQUIRE DEMONSTRATED NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA AND REQUIRES FILING THE FAFSA BY THE MARCH 2 PRIORITY DEADLINE EACH YEAR AND CONTINUED DEMONSTRATION OF NEED. THE MAJORITY OF THE AWARDS ARE FUNDED BY THE INSTITUTIONAL AID BUDGET BUT SMALL NUMBER ARE FUNDED BY THE ENDOWMENT AND HAVE DONOR SPECIFIC CRITERIA. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH UNIVERSITY ADVANCEMENT AND FISCAL MANAGEMENT TO AWARD THESE FUNDS.

Grants and assistance in furtherance of the institutions exempt programs are made to domestic students in college programs in accordance with established college procedures or are subject to conditions established by the institutions governing board designed to ensure that individuals receiving grants are adequately investigated to ensure that they are qualifying recipients. Such awards are made only to the extent of the cost of education further, recipients are judged worthy by the institutions assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards. The scholarships and grants are credited directly to the students account and the students do not have direct access to the funds for any other use.

THE FREEDOM FORUM INSTITUTE OFFERS SEVERAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS DURING THE YEAR. MONITORING OF THESE FUNDS IS NOT REQUIRED AS THE GRANTS ARE ONLY MADE TO THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO PARTICIPATE IN THE INSTITUTE'S CLASSES.
THE ORGANIZATION GAVE NON-CASH TUITION REDUCTION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET CRITERIA FOR SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.
INQUIRY BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WHETHER THE GRANTEES CONTINUE TO COMPLY WITH THEIR STATED PURPOSE.

UNIVERSITY OF PIKEVILLE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY ENTERING EACH STUDENT AND THEIR INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP ON THE UNIVERSITY'S ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE, DATATEL. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH BY THE UNIVERSITY ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
THE INSTITUTE MAINTAINS DETAILED RECORDS IN THE STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM DATABASE OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS REPRESENT SCHOLARSHIP/FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO U.S. STUDENTS TO ATTEND THE COLLEGE IN THE UNITED STATES. BENNINGTON MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF TRANSCRIPTS, GRADES, AND WRITTEN NARRATIVES BY BOTH FACULTY AND STUDENTS. PROGRESS TOWARD THE REQUIREMENTS TO COMPLETE A DEGREE IS CLOSELY MONITORED. GRANTS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO CURRENTLY ENROLLED STUDENTS.
THE ORGANIZATION ONLY GAVE NONCASH TUITION REDUCTION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET CRITERIA FOR SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.

NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WITH DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. RECIPIENTS OF NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION, BE US CITIZENS OR ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS, BE ENROLLED IN A DEGREE OR CERTIFICATE PROGRAM, AND BE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.

ALL STUDENTS MUST BE ENROLLED IN COLLEGE COURSES TO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS MUST ALSO MAINTAIN CERTAIN GRADE POINT AVERAGES AND MAKE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. OUR COMPUTER SYSTEM IS SET UP NOT TO AWARD ANY SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO NON-REGISTERED STUDENTS. A REPORT IS GENERATED AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER BY THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE SHOWING STUDENTS WHO ARE NOT MAINTAINING THE PROPER GRADE POINT AVERAGE OR WHO ARE NOT MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS. THIS REPORT IS REVIEWED BY THE FINACIAL AID OFFICE, ANY STUDENTS WHO DO NOT QUALIFY ACADEMICALLY FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS WILL NOT RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE STUDENT GRANTS AND AWARDS ARE FINANCIAL AID FUNDS WHICH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS DETERMINED EACH STUDENT WAS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE. THE BUSINESS OFFICE REVIEWS THEIR LIST, PRIOR TO ENTERING THE AWARDS DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENT'S TUITION ACCOUNT, AS PAYMENT. FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS PROVIDED MONTHLY REPORTS AS THESE AWARDS ARE EXPENSED OUT OF THE FINANCIAL AID BUDGET. STUDENTS ARE AWARE OF THESE AWARDS THROUGH VARIOUS PUBLICATIONS. STUDENTS HAVE DIRECT ACCESS TO ALL DETAILS OF THEIR TUITION ACCOUNT.

GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE MASTER OF DIVINITY PROGRAM AND ARE CHOSEN BASED ON NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS COMPLETED IN THE DEGREE PROGRAM, NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS TAKEN EACH TERM, AND FINANCIAL NEED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A WIDE VARIETY OF MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. MERIT AWARDS ARE GIVEN IN RECOGNITION OF VARIOUS ACHIEVEMENTS AS SPECIFIED IN DONORS' CORRESPONDENCE AND DOCUMENTS. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE PROVIDED BASED ON THE INCOME LEVEL AVAILABILITY OF AWARDS OFFERED ELSEWHERE AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY ONLY MAKES SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS THAT HELP OFFSET THE TUITION OF THE STUDENTS. THE GRANTS ARE DIRECTLY CREDITED AGAINST THE APPLICABLE STUDENT ACCOUNT WHICH ASSURES PROPER USE OF THE GRANT. THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANT IS ADJUSTED, AS NECESSARY, BASED ON ANY SUBSEQUENT CHANGES AFFECTING THE STUDENT'S ORIGINAL ELIGIBILITY.

YOUNG HARRIS COLLEGE DEVELOPS FINANCIAL AID AWARDS BASED UPON A COMBINATION OF FACTORS, INCLUDING THE STUDENT'S DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA OR OTHER FAMILY FINANCIAL INDICATOR AS ACCEPTED BY THE COLLEGE, HIGH SCHOOL GPA, AND SAT OR ACT SCORES. AID IS TO BE AWARDED IN THE MANNER WHICH BEST SERVES THE GREATEST NUMBER OF STUDENTS AND WHICH IS IN KEEPING WITH THE INTENT OF THE VARIOUS CAMPUS PROGRAMS. ALL INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STUDENT'S ABILITY TO MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE STUDENTS' SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS ANNUALLY FOR INSTITUTIONAL AID TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY. STANDARDS ARE SET ON QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE PROGRESS.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS: ALL GRANT FUNDS ARE DETERMINED AND AWARDED BY THE OFFICE OF ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT AND STUDENT FINANCIAL AID CONSISTENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICIES AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES. GRANTEES MUST MAINTAIN PREDETERMINED ACADEMIC LEVELS IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR SUBSEQUENT GRANTS. THE SCHOOL HAS AN ANNUAL CHARITY WEEK WHERE STUDENTS RAISE FUNDS AND VOTE ON ORGANIZATIONS TO GIVE DONATIONS. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT MONITOR ANY USE OF THE ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO THE CHOSEN ORGANIZATIONS. THE PURPOSE OF CHARITY WEEK IS TO TEACH THE STUDENTS THE VALUE OF GIVING TO CHARITIES THEY BELIEVE ARE WORTH GIVING ASSISTANCE.
THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO SPERTUS STUDENTS AND ARE USED TO OFFSET THEIR TUITION COSTS.
GRANTS AWARDED ARE PART OF AN OVERALL SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IN WHICH CRITERIA AND AMOUNTS AWARDED ARE RECORDED BY GRANTEE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDS PROVIDED FOR FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS OF ROSE-HULMAN FOLLOWS ALL REGULATIONS. EACH YEAR THE REGULATIONS ARE EVALUATED TO VERIFY THAT ALL REGULATIONS ARE BEING FOLLOWED BASED ON EACH FUNDS CRITERIA.

THE COLLEGE OFFERS SEVERAL SCHOLARSHIP OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS. THE PRIMARY SCHOLARSHIPS AND THE GUIDELINES FOR QUALIFYING ARE: FOUNDERS SCHOLARSHIPS - THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS UPON ACCEPTANCE TO A BACHELOR OF SCIENCE DEGREE PROGRAM AT VAUGHN. TO BE CONSIDERED, APPLICANTS MUST ATTAIN A CUMULATIVE HIGH SCHOOL AVERAGE OF AT LEAST A "B AND A COMBINED SAT1 SCORE OF AT LEAST 1000. STUDENTS WHO MEET THESE MINIMUM CRITERIAS WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR AWARDS, BASED ON THEIR GRADES AND EXAM SCORES, BY VAUGHN COLLEGE'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. THE AWARDS MAY BE RENEWABLE FOR UP TO FOUR YEARS OF CONSECUTIVE STUDY, PROVIDING THE RECIPIENT MAINTAINS A 3.0 CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA). BOARD OF TRUSTEES, #14 AND #36 GRANTS - THESE GRANTS ALLOCATE FUNDS TO BE USED IN AWARDING GRANT-IN-AID ASSISTANCE TO NEW AND CONTINUING STUDENTS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO ARE MATRICULATING ON A FULL OR PART-TIME BASIS IN BACHELOR AND ASSOCIATE DEGREE PROGRAMS. RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON THE BASIS OF THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND FINANCIAL AID STATUS. AWARDS ARE DESIGNATED FOR A SPECIFIC ACADEMIC YEAR AND ARE RENEWABLE EACH SEMESTER BASED ON SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. TRANSFER STUDENT SCHOLARSHIP - STUDENTS WHO TRANSFER TO THE COLLEGE HAVING COMPLETED 24 OR MORE CREDITS AT AN ACCREDITED COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY, AND WHO HAVE ACHIEVED A CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE OF AT LEAST 3.0 (INCLUDING ALL COURSES AT EVERY INSTITUTION ATTENDED) MAY BE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS TO TRANSFER. THE AWARDS MAY BE RENEWABLE FOR UP TO THREE YEARS OF CONSECUTIVE STUDY, PROVIDING THE RECIPIENT MAINTAINS A 3.0 CUMULATIVE GPA. ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE SCHOLARSHIPS - ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED EACH YEAR TO CONTINUING STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND SELECTION FOR ACADEMIC HONORS. THE CRITERIA APPLIED IN DECIDING ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS INCLUDE CUMULATIVE GPA AND SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF AT LEAST TWO SEMESTERS (29 CREDITS/UNITS OR MORE) AS A MATRICULATED STUDENT.

GRANTS ISSUED BY THE SEMINARY ARE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS FOR THEIR EDUCATIONAL ENDEAVORS AT THE SEMINARY. SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE BASED ON DONOR INTENT AND INTERNAL GUIDELINES, SUCH AS ACADEMIC ELIGIBILITY.

PSC PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO INDIVIDUALS TO ATTEND THE COLLEGE. THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND AID FOR SUCH STUDENTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT AND COVER THE COSTS OF TUITION, ROOM, AND BOARD. THE SCHOLARSHIP AND/OR FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON INSTITUTIONAL POLICY AND STANDARDS SET FORTH BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE STATE OF ARKANSAS. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE COMPLIANCE WITH SUCH REGULATIONS. THE SCHOLARSHIP AND/OR FINANCIAL AID IS APPLIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITH THE COLLEGE AS A REDUCTION IN FEES. AS A RESULT, THE GRANT CAN ONLY BE USED FOR ITS INTENDED PURPOSE (I.E. COST OF ATTENDANCE) AND CANNOT BE DIVERTED FROM THIS USE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Funds are only granted to organizations whose stated mission is limited to exempt activities compatible with Olivet University's mission.
GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND ACCOUNTING OFFICES.

The university's Office of Financial Aid monitors all recipients of scholarship awards to determine both initial and continuing eligibility based on the criteria for each type of award, which may include academic performance, financial need and criteria established by donors of endowed scholarship funds, etc.

THE COLLEGE, THROUGH ITS FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE AMOUNTS, ELIGIBILITY, AND SELECTION CRITERIA USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE ASSISTANCE BY REVIEWING GRADE TRANSCRIPTS AND ATTENDANCE RECORDS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS. FOR TUITION DISCOUNTS, IT IS THE STUDENT'S RESPONSIBILITY TO COMPLETE THE APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION PRIOR TO THE BEGINNING OF THE QUARTER FOR WHICH THE DISCOUNT IS REQUESTED. THE DEAN OF STUDENTS AND THE STUDENT RECEIVING THE DISCOUNT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR NOTIFYING THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ON A TIMELY BASIS OF ANY CHANGE IN THE STUDENT'S PERSONAL STATUS THAT WOULD HAVE BEARING ON THE STUDENT'S ENTITLEMENT TO THE DISCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WHOSE STAFF IS TRAINED AND CONTINUOUSLY EDUCATED REGARDING FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE STAFF OF THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT AND DETERMINES THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT CAN BE AWARDED TO THE STUDENT BASED ON FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF ALSO AWARDS GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ENDOWED GIFTS THAT COMPLY WITH THE TERMS OF THE ENDOWED GIFTS.

FINANCIAL AID AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS STANDARDS: TO REMAIN AT KNOX, ALL DEGREE-SEEKING STUDENTS ARE EXPECTED TO MAKE A SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS. SATISFACTORY PROGRESS IS DEFINED BOTH IN TERMS OF THE ACCUMULATION OF CREDITS TOWARDS THE DEGREE, AND THE MAINTENANCE OF A GRADE POINT AVERAGE CONSISTENT WITH GRADUATION REQUIREMENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOLLOWS THE DECISION OF THE ACADEMIC STANDING COMMITTEE IN DETERMINING WHETHER A STUDENT IS MEETING THE COLLEGE'S SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS STANDARDS.

The financial aid planning office at Toccoa Falls College requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the College does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a College sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the College catalog and the College website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the College to ensure students remain eligible for funds awarded. Scholarships are applied directly to the student accounts.

COSTS CHARGED TO SPONSORED AGREEMENTS ARE FULLY INTEGRATED WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM ACCUMULATES COSTS ACCORDING TO INDEX, FUND AND ACCOUNT CODE CATEGORIES. ASSOCIATED AND IDENTIFIED WITH EACH FUND ARE VARIOUS ATTRIBUTES SUCH AS PROJECT TITLE, SPONSOR, AND PRINCIPAL.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE THAT IS PROVIDED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY TO STUDENTS IS DESIGNATED FOR TUITION, FEES, BOOKS, AND OTHER DIRECT EDUCATIONAL COSTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND FINANCE OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS AND CONTROLS DISBURSEMENT OF ALL ASSISTANCE.

The College has a professionally staffed financial aid office charged with the responsibility of ensuring that all recipients meet all eligibility criteria ensuring that the College is in compliance with all government regulations pertaining to financial aid.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Most grants are in the form of financial aid awarded to students. Grants are applied internally to the student's account with the University. The funds are used to pay the tuition, fees and room and board that are applied to the students' accounts. A small number of grants are made to faculty for research or curriculum development. Reports are required by the granting committee to ensure progress is made in concert with the grant proposal. All expenses of these grants are made through the University accounting system.

The procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds are Martin University only awards institutional and privately funded financial aid awards as assistance for students based on a case by case basis, based on merit and need. In doing so, the University's Financial Aid department adheres to all federal and state regulations and is subject to the internal control requirements of the OMB circular A-133.

FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BY FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE COLLEGE POLICIES. GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN PART II ARE TO SUPPORT LOCAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS IN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III CASH GRANTS ARE CREDITS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

Scholarships are available to all students meeting the written criteria for the award of the scholarship. All scholarships and discounts are awarded by the financial aid department based on the established policies. Scholarships are directly applied to the student account.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE ORGANIZATION USES STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY ONLY AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL AND PRIVATELY FUNDED FINANCIAL AID AWARD AS ASSISTANCE FOR STUDENTS BASED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS, BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. IN DOING SO, THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ADHERES STRICTLY TO ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROL REQUIREMENTS OF OMB-A133, IN WHICH THEY FOLLOW ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS GRANTS AND OTHER FORMS OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS BASED ON REVIEW OF SELECT DATA AND ACCORDING TO A SPECIFIED METHODOLOGY. DATA USED IS MAINTAINED IN EITHER PHYSICAL OR ELECTRONIC FORMAT UNTIL NO LONGER REQUIRED BY RECORD RETENTION GUIDELINES. GENERALLY, ALL RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR THE MOST RECENT FISAP REPORTING YEAR, PLUS THE THREE YEARS PRIOR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: IONA COLLEGE GIVES AID TO STUDENTS IN TWO FORMS: MERIT AID AND NEEDS BASED AID. THE AMOUNT OF MERIT AID A STUDENT RECEIVES IS BASED ON A CALCULATED ACADEMIC INDEX THAT IS DERIVED FROM THEIR GPA & SAT SCORES. NEED BASED AID IS DETERMINED FROM THE STUDENT EFC. STUDENTS ARE GIVEN THESE AWARDS UPON ACCEPTANCE TO THE COLLEGE AND THE AWARDS ARE RENEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS ASSUMING THE STUDENT MEETS THE REQUIRED CUMULATIVE GPA AND THEIR NEED AS DETERMINED BY FAFSA HAS NOT CHANGED. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ISSUED BY THE COLLEGE ARE INTENDED TO BE USED TO DEFRAY TUITION COSTS AND ENABLE STUDENTS TO MATRICULATE AT IONA COLLEGE, THE STUDENT HAS NO DISCRETION ON HOW TO EXPEND THOSE FUNDS. ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT FORMALLY MONITOR THE USE OF THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS SINCE IT IS REQUIRED THAT SUCH FUNDS BE USED TO OFFSET TUITION COSTS.

VALPARAISO UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING RESOURCES NECESSARY TO HELP STUDENTS COMPLETE THEIR EDUCATION. IN SELECTING THE STUDENTS TO RECEIVE THIS ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY PLACES PRIMARY EMPHASIS ON THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED. AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY THE UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. UPON ENROLLMENT VERIFICATION, THE AWARDS ARE USED TO OFFSET THE COST OF ATTENDANCE.

EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY AWARDS TUITION GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS. THE GRANTS REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF TUITION AND FEES THAT THAT STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO PAY TO THE SEMINARY. THE SEMINARY MAINTAINS RECORDS OF THE GRANTS AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID RECORDS AND FOLLOWS APPROPRIATE SELECTION CRITERIA FOR ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO STUDENTS. THE UNIVERSITY HAS AN ANNUAL COMPLIANCE AUDIT CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133 EACH YEAR. FOR THE YEAR ENDED 6/30/2019, THE AUDIT REPORTED THAT THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIED, IN ALL MATERIAL RESPECTS, WITH THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF ITS MAJOR FEDERAL PROGRAMS.

THE UNIVERSITY DISTRIBUTES SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USING THE INFORMATION FROM THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID). MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE USING THE INFORMATION FROM THE STUDENT'S OFFICIAL HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS AND THE RESULTS OF THE STANDARDIZED TEST (ACT, SAT, ETC.). FOR STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS WITH RENEWAL CONDITIONS, FULFILLMENT OF THOSE CONDITIONS ARE VERIFIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTRATOR PRIOR TO THE AWARD BEING RENEWED (GPA, YEAR OF ATTENDANCE, ETC.)

All students seeking need based financial assistance are required to complete the FAFSA, Eligibility, or need, is determined through federal methodology and resulting Expected Family Contribution as set against standard cost of attendance. Need based aid is awarded based on federal and/or state eligibility requirements and institutional aid is awarded according to institutional policy. Amounts of aid awarded are in compliance with governing regulations or institutional policy. In compliance with Title IV regulations, total aid from all sources cannot exceed need or the annual cost of attendance, regardless of the level of need. Aid awards are posted to student accounts as an offset to semester charges. Institutional policy prohibits the release or refund of aid to students unless total charges for the semester have been paid.
THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS AND APPLIES CRITERIA BASED ON CIRCUMSTANCE, GRADE-POINT AVERAGE AND NEED. THE PROCESS IS APPLIED CONSISTENTLY TO ALL STUDENTS OF THE INSTITUTION.
USE OF GRANTS IS MONITORED THROUGH OBSERVATION OF THE ONSITE WORK OF THE RESEARCHERS.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED EACH YEAR BY FINANCIAL AID IN CONJUNCTION/CONSULTATION WITH THE ADVANCEMENT DEPARTMENT.
Grant funds are credited to student accounts in the form of need-based financial aid that reduce the comprehensive fee.
THE ORGANIZATION TRACKS THE USE OF THE FUNDS AWARDED. AMOUNTS USED AND UNUSED ARE TRACKED ANNUALLY AND JUSTIFIED AT FISCAL YEAR END.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: CENTRAL COLLEGE EMPLOYEES REVIEW COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE GRANTS RECEIVED. IN ADDITION, CENTRAL COLLEGE IS REQUIRED TO PARTICIPATE AND FILE THE FEDERAL SINGLE AUDIT OF FINANCIAL AID PERFORMED BY OUR EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM.

The School offers both need based and merit based financial assistance. Need based financial assistance is given in the form of grants to students with demonstrated need who would not otherwise be able to attend the school. All need based awards are reviewed annually. Applicants and returning families who are interested in need based financial aid must apply each year with current financial information by the published deadlines. Unless there is significant change in a family's financial situation, returning students who meet the financial aid application deadlines can expect the level of aid to be consistent from year to year. If a boarding student becomes a day student or vice versa, the financial aid will adjust accordingly. The School also offers new students the opportunity to apply for two merit based scholarships each year - one for a boarding student and one for a Raleigh student. These scholarships are solely dependent on an applicant's merit and do not consider a family's financial need. Students who apply for either merit scholarship are also eligible to apply for need based assistance. Applicants must adhere to the deadlines and listed requirements in order to be considered for these scholarships.

THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION AWARDS FUNDS TO INSTITUTIONS IN SUPPORT OF RESEARCH ACROSS THE CAROLINAS COLLABORATIVE. UNIVERSITY FACULTY MEMBERS ARE ENCOURAGED TO SUBMIT PROPOSALS DETAILING THEIR RESEARCH OBJECTIVES. PROPOSALS MEETING THE PREDETERMINED CRITERIA ARE APPROVED FOR FUNDING BY THE SELECTION COMMITTEE. FUNDS ARE DISBURSED ON A PREDETERMINED SCHEDULE BASED ON THE AGREED UPON MILESTONES. EACH RECIPIENT IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND SUBMIT PROGRESS REPORTS THAT INCLUDE ACTUAL COSTS INCURRED.

The financial aid office at William Jessup University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State and institutional grants, scholarships, and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University. Financial aid awarded is applied directly to student accounts and no cash changes hands. Occasional grants are awarded to 501(c)(3) organizations that support education and whose exempt purpose are consistent with the University's mission.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grants distributed by Dartmouth consist primarily of scholarships, fellowships and related support given to Dartmouth students. Scholarships are awarded based on the financial need of the student. Scholarship applications are reviewed by a financial aid officer. Financial aid officers are expected to recuse themselves from any case in which they either have a personal interest or feel they cannot be impartial. A random sampling of cases read by each undergraduate financial aid officer is reviewed by the Associate and Senior Associate Directors to ensure compliance with federal regulations, adherence to Dartmouth policies, consistency in results and accuracy. Scholarships are credited to an individual student's account through the Banner Student Information system after the student has enrolled for the term (these credits are included in "non-cash assistance" in Part III above) Scholarship funds are withdrawn if the student ceases to be enrolled. Fellowships are granted in support of a student's educational or research endeavors. All educational and research work is monitored by Dartmouth faculty. The Dartmouth Entrepreneurial Network (DEN) has educational and funding programs that promote entrepreneurship within the Dartmouth College community. Prizes and awards reported in Part II represent DEN programs that include startup competitions which are open to Dartmouth College students, faculty, staff and alumni. Entries are evaluated by a group of Dartmouth College alumni, entrepreneurs and expert business practitioners, on the basis of which businesses are most likely to create significant social and/or economic value.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND DONOR RESIDENCE WHILE GRANTS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND STANDARDS AS DESIGNATED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO KNOWN NON-PROFITS. THE ORGANIZATION SUPPPORTS ITS RELATED ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL CHARITIES AND DOES NOT MONITOR THE FUNDS AFTER THEY ARE DISBURSED.

BERKELEY DIVINITY SCHOOL MAINTAINS CERTAIN RESTRICTED ENDOWMENTS AND IS THE BENEFICIARY OF CERTAIN THIRD-PARTY TRUSTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIP AID TO STUDENTS. THE INCOME FROM THESE FUNDS IS PAID DIRECTLY TO YALE UNIVERSITY PER THE TERMS OF THE AFFILIATION AGREEMENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF YALE DIVINITY SCHOOL IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THE FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC MERIT OF STUDENTS, AND FOR MAKING ALL SCHOLARSHIP/FINANCIAL AID AWARDS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO FACULTY AND STUDENTS FROM OUTSIDE AGENCIES AND THE FUNDS ARE SENT DIRECTLY TO THE UNIVERSITY TO BE MANAGED. ORIGINAL RECEIPTS ARE SUBMITTED TO PROVIDE SUBSTANTIATION OF EXPENSES AND FINAL REPORTS ARE FORWARDED TO THE SPONSORS. SEE SCHEDULE O.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid Eligibility Requirements * Complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) annually and as early as January 1 (Temple's priority deadline is March 1) * Sign statements on the FAFSA stating that: * you are not in default on a federal student loan and do not owe money on a federal student grant and * you will use federal student aid only for educational purposes * Comply with Temple University's Satisfactory Academic Progress Standards * Remain in good standing on educational loans and grants per the National Student Loan Database System (NSLDS) * Remain enrolled at least part-time per semester for Federal loans (6 credits as an undergraduate student and 4.5 credits as a graduate student) * Be enrolled in an eligible degree program at Temple University * Be a citizen or eligible non-citizen with a valid Social Security Number * Have a high school diploma or recognized equivalent * Be registered for the Selective Service if you are male and 18-25 years of age * Comply with any and all federal verification requests made by Student Financial Services Research Administration Processing an Award - Negotiation of SubAward(s) If the University receives an award and a portion of the activity is to be sub-contracted to another entity, Sponsored Programs assists the PI in development of a sub-contract which outlines the sub-contractor's role in meeting the requirements of the award. Sponsored Programs forwards the sub-contract to the sub-contractor for review and signature. Upon return of the executed document, the PI should complete a Financial Impact Statement. Sponsored Programs forwards the sub-contract and Financial Impact Statement to University Counsel, where review and appropriate signature(s) and seal (if necessary) are obtained. When the University is the recipient of a sub-contract similar procedures are followed.
STUDENTS RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS AS CREDITS AGAINST TUITION. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS CAN BE BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND/OR ATHLETICS.

ALL SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA AS SET BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID POLICIES. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE POSTED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO BE APPLIED AGAINST CHARGES FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM, AND BOARD.
ALL GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH EACH GRANT. THEY ARE ALSO MONITORED BY MEMBERS OF SENIOR STAFF.
THE FOUNDATION MONITORS ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS BY ASSESSING STUDENT RECORDS, FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS APPLICATIONS FOR AWARDS.
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF REDUCTION OF TUITION. THE FELLOW PROGRAM SPANS OVER 2 YEARS AND THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES INSTRUCTIONAL MODULES THROUGHOUT THE DURATION OF THE PROGRAM.

PCOM MAINTAINS RECORDS OF AMOUNTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS, ELIGIBILITY FOR WHICH IS DETERMINED BY FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT REQUIREMENTS. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ISSUED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED AGAINST STUDENTS' TUITION ACCOUNT. NO CASH IS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS.
MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: ALL GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER VERIFYING ENROLLMENT STATUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE ADMISSION DEPARTMENT AND OTHER DEPARTMENTS WILL FORWARD REPORTS TO THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT INDICATING WHICH STUDENTS QUALIFIED FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS.

GRANTS ISSUED BY IMMACULATA UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY IN THE FORM OF SCHOLAYSHIP AND GRANTS AWARDED AS PART OF FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED BY THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET BILLED AMOUNTS (I.E. TUITION) ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, THEREBY REDUCING THE NET BALANCE DUE TO THE UNIVERSITY. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ASSESSED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEEDS, AND SIMILAR STANDARDS.

THE MAJORITY OF GRANT FUNDS AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID TO ITS STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS NEED AND MERIT BASE AID BASED ON THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE UNIVERSITY. THE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM AT SETON HILL UNIVERSITY ASSISTS STUDENTS WHO WOULD FIND IT DIFFICULT OR IMPOSSIBLE TO ATTEND COLLEGE WITHOUT SOME FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM OF FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, PART-TIME EMPLOYMENT, AND DEFERRED PAYMENT SCHEDULES, AND COORDINATES ITS PROGRAMS WITH THE FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. ANY OF THESE FORMS OF FINANCIAL AID MAY BE OFFERED INDEPENDENTLY OR IN VARIOUS COMBINATIONS TO A STUDENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ESTIMATES THE COST OF ATTENDING SETON HILL UNIVERSITY BY ADDING TUITION, ROOM, BOARD AND FEES PLUS AN ESTIMATE FOR BOOKS, SUPPLIES, TRANSPORTATION FROM HOME TO SCHOOL AND PERSONAL EXPENSES. THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID AN APPLICANT RECEIVES IS BASED ON THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TOTAL COSTS AND THE AMOUNT THE STUDENT AND FAMILY ARE ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE TOWARD COSTS AS DETERMINED BY THE NEEDS ANALYSIS FORM.

POEC gives need-based and merit-based scholarships. Need-based scholarships are monitored through the Department of Education FAFSA form. Students with $0 estimated family contribution (EFC), based on the Department of Education guidelines, will be automatically awarded a scholarship. Merit-based scholarships are granted to students who submit all required documentation by certain deadlines and apply with good academic standing.

SIENA HEIGHTS UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FUNDING FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON MERIT, FINANCIAL NEED, SPECIAL CRITERIA BASED ON RESTRICTED FUND ENDOWMENTS AND DONOR CRITERIA, AND INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT ON THE SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES PAYMENT OF THE GRANTS TO THE STUDENT AS A CREDIT TO THE STUDENTS' RECEIVABLE ACCOUNTS; THE GRANTS ARE NOT DIRECTLY PAID TO THE STUDENTS. FOR THE GRANT TO BE AVAILABLE TO THE STUDENT, THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE STUDENTS ENROLLMENT AND THE STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED AND ACTIVE FOR THE TIME PERIOD THE GRANT IS OFFERED. IF THE STUDENT LEAVES THE PROGRAM EARLY, THE GRANT IS NOT REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT AND THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT IS RATABLY ADJUSTED TO REFLECT THE INCOMPLETE PERIOD.

GENEVA COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS BASED UPON THE FOLLOWING: THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON MERIT AND FINANCIAL NEED. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE MAINTAIN RECORDS ON WHAT STUDENTS ARE AWARDED, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS SPECIFIC CRITERIA THAT MUST BE FOLLOWED IN AWARDING AID TO STUDENTS. THE CRITERIA FOR AWARDING AID IS DOCUMENTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

STUDENT ENROLLMENT IS MONITORED ON A REGULAR BASIS. AFTER VERIFICATION OF ENROLLMENT EACH TERM, FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS' EDUCATIONAL COSTS PER FEDERAL REGULATIONS. STUDENT WITHDRAWALS ARE ALSO MONITORED AND GRANT FUNDS ARE ADJUSTED AND RETURNED AS NECESSARY. EXPENSES AND INCOME FOR OTHER GRANTS ARE TRACKED IN ACCOUNTS SET UP SPECIFICALLY FOR THE GRANT. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A PROJECT INVESTIGATOR THAT OVERSEES THE SPENDING OF THE FUNDS AND ENSURES THEY ARE USED AS INTENDED.

STUDENTS RECEIVE THEIR SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS SIX WEEKS AFTER THE BEGINNING OF THE SEMESTER TO ENSURE THAT THEY HAVE EARNED THE AWARD. TUITION AND FEES ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE COLLEGE, THE REMAINDER IS GIVEN TO THE STUDENT FOR LIVING EXPENSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Schedule I, Part I, Line 2
ExplntnTxt: MONITORING GRANTS SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS. TOURO UNIVERSITY MONITORS ALL REQUESTS FOR USE OF GRANT FUNDS AGAINST THE SUBMITTED BUDGETS FOR THE RESPECTIVE GRANTS.
